loans.name: Minnie

texts.en: Minnie, 45 years old, is married and has eight children, six of them in school. Minnie works very hard to provide for them. For the past 4 years, Minnie has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. to sell. In the future, Minnie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dyma

texts.en: Dyma, 35 years old, is married and has four children, three of them in school. Dyma is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Dyma has operated a business selling seafood in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell. In the future, Dyma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming flowers in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, flower pots, new seeds, etc.

Marilyn has been farming flowers for four years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, flower pots, new seeds, etc.

loans.name: Nancy Elizabeth

texts.es: Nancy es una joven de 23 años, vive con sus padres donde se dedica a trabajar a la agricultura al igual que sus padres, ella padece de una enfermedad contra la que lucha diariamente, ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una ternera para aumentar con sus otras terneras que tiene en terrenitos que arrienda para tener hierba para sus animalitos, lo que Nancy aspira es que mejore su negocio  para salir adelante y en algún momento curarse completamente.
texts.en: Nancy is a young 23 year old woman.  She lives with her parents where she is engaged in farming like her parents.  She suffers from an illness, which she fights against daily.  She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a calf to raise with her other calves that she has on lands that she leases in order to have grass for her animals.  Nancy aspires to improve her business so she can get ahead and eventually be completely cured.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo, aged 45 and a father of four, has been running a general store for over two years. His wife helps him run the business. It is doing well and it helps a lot in sustaining their daily needs. Rodrigo joined GDMPC and is borrowing a new loan  to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, he wants to expand the business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Jennifer would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Jennifer's business profits will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. Jennifer looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jennifer still hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es: Sandra es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 11 años de edad que se encentran estudiando, Sandra se dedica desde hace 20 años atrás al  trabajo del campo  y a la crianza de animales, en esta ocasión va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca para mejorar su negocio y por ende aumentar sus ingresos, Sandra aspira que su negocio crezca y a futuro comprarse un terrenito para  tener ahí sus vacas.
texts.en: Sandra is married and has two children, ages 10 and 11, who are in school.  She has been engaged in farm work and raising animals for twenty years.  At this time, she is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a cow to improve her business and, therefore, increase her income.  Sandra aspires to grow her business and, in the future, to purchase a piece of land in order to have her cows there.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 04 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijos y su conyugue, él vive en el caserio de Vista Alegre. Caserio mediano, en dicho caserio la poblacion se dedica a la agricultura cultivando café; y está ubicado en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Rolando se dedica a la cria y engorde de ganado, hace más de 10 años, en el Caserio Vista Alegre. Rolando necesita del crédito porque desea invertir en la compra de un par de novillas para engordarlo y luego venderlos. Rolando Posee conocimiento en el negocio y con esto logrará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias, y por ende una mejora en la calidad de vida de él y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando, 29, is in a common-law relationship, and has four dependent children.  He lives with his partner and children in Vista Alegre, a medium-sized village where the people are engaged in farming, cultivating coffee.  The village is located in the Callayuc district, province and region of Cajamarca, in Peru’s Northern Sierra.

Rolando has been engaged in breeding and fattening livestock for ten years in the village of Vista Alegre.  He needs the loan because he wishes to in invest in the purchase of a pair of heifers to fatten and later sell.Rolando has business knowledge and with this, he will achieve higher income, better profits and, therefore, an improvement in his quality of life and that of his entire family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a pair of heifers to fatten and later sell..

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 35 años de edad,  está casada pero aun no ha tenido hijos. Su esposo esta en el extranjero trabajando.
Doña Sonia es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganar lo suyo para salir adelante, ella  se dedica a la venta de productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella realiza sus recorridos  todos los días ya que así se entretiene visitando sus clientes aunque también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra  cada semana. Tiene más de 3 años con esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la puntualidad de los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio” (Women of the New Millenium) is a group that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.
Here is where Sonia lives. She is 35 years old, she is married but she has no children yet. Her husband works abroad.
Sonia is a woman who has always wanted to get ahead in life by earning her own money. She engages in selling Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and products for women). She sells her products door to door, and she works every in order to visit her customers, even though she also sells products in her house. She sells on credit and retrieves money every week. She has been engaging in this activity for more than 3 years, and this is how she provides for herself.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products that she sells. She has been a member of this group for more than 10 years and she likes it because of the reliability of the loans. Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier esta casado, tiene un hijo y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Javier se gana la vida como enfermero en un hospital y tambien trabaja como chofer en sus horas libres, Jvier quiere un credito para pagar el mantenimiento de su vehiculo Javier es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y no tiene deudas pendientes
texts.en: Javier is married with one son, and lives in a brick and cement house in La Paz.  Javier earns his living as a nurse at a hospital and also works as a driver in his free time.  He wants a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.  He is the only source of income in his home, but enjoys good health and doesn’t have any outstanding debts.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija mayor  de edad que aun vive en su casa. El marido artesano.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así sacar adelante a su hogar, ella y su marido son artesanos, fabrican cofres, joyeros hechos en madera con muchos diseños, también elaboran imágenes en conchas de mar, una vez que ellos realizan sus trabajos los llevan a vender a san Jacinto o en Bahía De Caraquez, lugares donde llegan muchos turistas que gustan de sus obras las mismas que venden a muy buen precio, son más de 20 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar madera y pinturas para elaborar sus trabajos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio” (Women of the New Millenium) is a group that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.
Here is where Maria lives. She is 53 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has an adult daughter who live in a house of her own. Her husband is an artisan.
Maria is a woman who likes working for herself and for her family; she and her husband are artisans, and they create wooden chests and jewelry boxes in many different styles. They also create images with seashells. Once their products are ready, they sell them in San Jacinto or in Bahía De Caraquez, as both places are packed with tourists who like their products. Their prices are fair, and the have been engaged in this activity for more than 20 years, and this is how they provides for themselves.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wood and paints to prepare their products. She has been a member of this group since the beginning and she likes it because they grant her the loans. Her dreams are to progress in her life and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: T buy wood and paints.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, etc. for her business.

Letecia has been in this business for 34 years now.

Letecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, etc. for her business

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de calzado, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo han logra salir adelante, Modesta esta solicitando un crédito para comprar de materia prima como: suelas, cuero, hebillas, pega, hilos, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con la elaboración del calzado  y asi tener mejores ingresos y darle a s familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Modesta is 55 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and three children. For the past three years, she has been manufacturing and selling shoes. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers because of the quality of her product and the good prices. Her husband helps with the work and they have been able to get ahead.

Modesta is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials such as soles, leather, buckles, adhesive, thread, and items in bulk so that she can continue making shoes. As a result, she can have a better income and provide better financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy soles, leather, buckles, adhesive, thread, and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
This is Gleceria. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan was also useful in the education of her child. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gleceria hopes to have an outlet of her own merchandise products and items someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and products to offer for sale, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nomi

texts.en:
Nomi is 45 years old and a widow with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

Nomi has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Nomi would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Buena Esperanza está formado por 8 socias y 2 socios, quienes se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y trabajadoras, que luchan el día a día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y para brindándoles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar de clima frió, desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta ciudad mantiene su belleza natural y cultural. Su gente es de un corazón cálido y mantienen la Cultura y Tradiciones de sus pueblos. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, tiene 55 años de edad, es separa y fruto de su unión ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hija soltera trabaja y  estudia en el colegio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña María desde hace 10 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, vende ambulantemente y también cuenta con locales comerciales en donde realiza sus entregas. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres y ollas para la preparación de sus productos. Su sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) includes eight women and two men. All of them are known for being friendly, kind, and hardworking people who strive day after day to improve their household finances and to provide a better future for their children. They live in the city of Cuenca, a place that has cold weather. Since December 1999, Cuenca has been known for being a World Heritage Site. This city maintains it natural and cultural beauty. The people are warm-hearted and maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members is Sra. María. She is 55 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four grown children. Three of her children are married and live independently. Her single daughter works and attends high school. María and her family do not own a house, so they are living in a rental property.

Doña María has been preparing and selling food for 10 years. She sells as a street vendor, but also at shopping centers where she makes deliveries. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of provisions and pots for preparing her dishes. Her dream is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy provisions and pots for her food business.

loans.name: Relampago Group

texts.es:
Relámpago  es el nombre de un grupo conformado por 10 personas, trabajadoras, humildes y carismáticas que tienen una actividad económica para cubrir los gastos de su familia.

La región donde se encuentra el grupo es una zona cañera, recientemente la población se ha dedicado a la siembre de producto alternativo (limón, plátano, frijol, maíz) para su autoconsumo, pero también venden el producto en pequeñas cantidades y así obtienen ganancias extra.

La construcción de la carretera que pasa por la comunidad es una gran fuente de empleo justo ahora que la zafra (época de corte de caña) aún no inicia. Durante los seis meses de zafra, las personas forman parte de alguna cuadrilla en las plantaciones de caña, manejan alguna máquina, acarrean la caña y algunos más trabajan como obreros en el ingenio (molino de azúcar).

Relámpago fue el nombre que eligieron para el grupo por la rapidez con la cual VisionFund México les otorgó el préstamo.Los integrantes son:

Maricruz- Venta De Comida
Judith - Perfumes Por Catalogo
Delfina - Venta De Papelería Y Mercería
Lucia - Venta De Refrescos
Rolando - Venta De Abarrotes
Liliana - Venta De Refrescos
Cristina - Venta De Avon
Elba - Venta De Refrescos
Rogelia - Venta De Pollo

La señora Elba está casada con Pedro, tienen 3 hijos que estudian la primaria. Doña Elba necesita invertir en la compra de harina, mantequilla, moldes, leche, mermelada, durazno y una batidora para la elaboración de pasteles pues hace 6 años tomó varios cursos de repostería y lleva 4 años vendiendo postres para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, principalmente ahora que él tiene dificultad para hallar un trabajo estable. "Mi familia es el motor principal", para Elba las risas de sus hijos es lo mejor que puede escuchar y son una motivación para seguir trabajando a diario en la cocina.

"Con la oportunidad que VisionFund México nos ha brindado, pretendo abrir una pequeña pastelería".

En la imagen: Doña Elba viste de blusa color café y está sentada detrás de la señora de blusa azul (lado izquierdo).
texts.en:
Relámpago is the name of this group made up of 10 people; hardworking, humble and charismatic, who have jobs to meet the costs of their families.

The region where this group lives is a sugarcane area, lately the inhabitants have been working growing alternative products (lemons, bananas, beans, corn) for their consumption, but they also sell product in small quantities to obtain additional income.

The construction of the road that passes through the community is a great source of employment right now that the harvest (sugarcane cutting season) has not yet started. During the six months of the harvest, the people form part of a crew in the sugar plantations, managing a machine, hauling sugarcane and some work as laborers at the mill (sugar mill).

Relámpago [lightening] was the name chosen by the group due to the speed at which VisionFund México granted this loan.

The members are:

Maricruz- food sales
Judith - perfumes from catalogues
Delfina - stationery and haberdashery sales
Lucia - drink sales
Rolando - grocery sales
Liliana - drink sales
Cristina - Avon sales
Elba - drink sales
Rogelia - chicken sales

Elba is married to Pedro, they have 3 children who go to primary school. Elba needs to invest in buying flour, butter, molds, milk, jam, peaches, and a mixer to make cakes, as 6 years ago she took various courses in baking and has been selling cakes for 4 years to support her husband with expenses, mainly now that he is having difficulty finding a stable job. "My family is my main drive", for Elba the laughter of her children is the best thing she could ever hear and are a motivation to keep working every day in the kitchen.

"With the opportunity that VisionFund México has offered us, I aim to open a small patisserie".

In the picture: Elba is wearing a brown blouse and is sitting behind the lady with a blue blouse (left side).

loans.use: to buy: flour, butter, molds, milk, jam, peaches, a mixer.

location.town: ARROYO DE ENMEDIO, ACATLAN DE PEREZ FIGUEROA

loans.name: Rosa Marleni

texts.es:
Rosa Marleni tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de La Florida, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de San Miguel que pertenece a la Provincia de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Rosa Marleni tiene una bodega que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio donde ofrece venta de abarrotes, leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, artículos de aseo, entre otros; ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 5 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería, lo que le va a permitir aumentar y diversificar su stock, para complacer a sus clientes con todos los procductos que puedieran desear y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Marleni is 40 years old. She lives with her son in the district of La Florida, a community that makes a living from agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the San Miguel province, which is situation in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Rosa Marleni has a small grocery store that is located in her home. There, she sells groceries, milk, oil, rice, sugar, soda, toiletries, etc. She has made a living off her business for the past five years, and is now asking for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to buy more merchandise. This will allow her to increase and diversify her stock in order to please her customers with all the products they may want. That way, she will generate more income, more earnings, and in the end, better her quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase and diversify her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos, viven en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Saña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, dicha zona esta ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juan Carlos se dedica a la actividad de venta de agregados de construcción civil, como arenilla, hormigón y piedra, desde hace más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Él solicita préstamo para la compra de una moto carguera la cual será usada para repartir su producto (material de construcción). De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 42 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in a home located in a big community in the urban zone known as Sana. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. He has a lot of good personal and work references from neighbors.

Juan Carlos makes a living selling supplies for construction, such as gravel, concrete, and stone. He has had this business, in his own home, for more than 10 years. He is asking for a loan to buy a moto freighter, which will be used to deliver his product (construction material). That way, he will be able to grow his business, obtain more profits, and better his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a moto freighter, which will be used to deliver his product (building material)

loans.name: Unidos Por Jehova Group

texts.es: Kely de 29 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella forma parte del grupo “Unidos Por Jehová” y está formado por 05 socias solidarias y responsables. Kely se dedica a la venta de productos naturales. Gracias a su perseverancia puede darles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de té verde, batido de piña, semillas de chía y  leche de linaza. Su mayor deseo es contar son su local propio para poder exhibir sus productos. El grupo “Unidos Por Jehová” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios. Kely es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca celeste. En la parte superior a lado derecho se encuentra Máxima  la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Kely is 29 years old. She is separated, and has two independent children. She is part of the group "Unidos Por Jehova," which is made up of 5 solidary and responsible members. Kely makes a living selling natural products. Thanks to her perserverance, she is able to provide a better education to her children.

She is asking for this loan to buy green tea, blended pineapple, chia seeds, and flax milk. Her greatest desire is to have her own space to showcase her products. The group "Unidos por Jehova" is very grateful to the lenders at giving for giving them the opportunity to grow their businesses. 

Kely is the first on the left wearing the blue tunic. In the upper right hand corner is Maxima, who was not able to arrive on time for work purposes.

loans.use: to buy green tea, blended pineapple, chia seeds, and flax milk.

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarangerel, 52 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For six years, she has been renting out some vacant rooms of her house to students, who have come from the countryside to study. Her husband is a welder and works at a private firm.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,700,000 MNT to pay for her elder daughter's tuition fees. She wants her daughter to study hard and to acquire the knowledge necessary for a white collar job. In the profile picture, the borrower is with her husband and younger daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her oldest daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 56 años, es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a esposa y 01 hijo; en el sector Popan Alto del distrito de Cayalti. Juan tiene una familia unida y vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque.

Juan se dedica principalmente al cultivo y venta de alfalfa, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos y aves de corral(patos, pollos, conejos, entre otrso); a la venta de leche de vacas junto a su esposa y adicionalmente también cuenta con más de 04 hás de caña de azucar en pie y 02 hás de maíz. La inversión del crédito es para la compra de insumos agrícolas para mantenimiento de su cultvo. Con ello tendrá una mejor calidad de caña de azucar lo cual asegurará un mejor producto para la venta y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old, is married, and lives in his own home with his wife and one son. They live in Popan Alto, which is located in the Cayalti district. Juan has a very united family, and lives in a community that makes a living in trade, agriculture, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region.

Juan makes a living primarily in growing and selling alfalfa. He also raises and sells goats and poultry (ducks, chickens, and rabbits, among others). Him and his wife also sell cow's milk, and they own more than four hectares of sugar cane and two hectares of corn.

He is asking for the loan to buy agricultural supplies in order to maintain his crops. He will improve the quality of his sugar cane to ensure he is offering the best product. This will help him to generate more income to better his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and is married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gina has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. Gina has been in this business for eight years.

Gina is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional coffee, powdered milk and sugar. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money in order to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional coffee, powdered milk and sugar.

loans.name: Milyn

texts.en:
Milyn works hard to support her family. Milyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 5 years.

Milyn is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Milyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a single 48-year-old man.

He owns and manages a small retail store in his community to generate income. He aims to improve his store and to increase his income in order to pay for his living expenses, save for his future and support the education of his niece and nephews. He would like to acquire more groceries to re-sell to his customers but he has limited capital to do so.

For this reason, he would like access to financial assistance from KIVA lenders. Specifically, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase sugar, oil, seasonings, canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, juice, candies, frozen foods and breads to re-sell. He believes that this financial support will be a great help for him to enable him to grow his business.

loans.use: to expand and improve his retain business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., sugar, oil, seasonings, canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, juice, candy, frozen foods and breads) for re-sale purposes

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
Misael tiene 41 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rustico en el distrito de Chalaco con sus menores hijos, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Dicho distrito pertenece a la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Misael es el serivio de trasnporte teniendo linea( Morropon- Santo Domingo), cuenta ya con 5 años de antigüedad en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para reparación y mantenimiento de vehiculo que utiliza para realizar su transporte, esto le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos.

El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido que en la zona ya no hay lluvias y permitiendo tener salidas diarias al Distrito del Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
Misael is 41 years old. He is married and lives in his own house made of rustic materials in the district of Chalaco with his young children. The district is a place where most of the population makes a living from agriculture, livestock, and trade. There are basic services like water and electricy. This district belongs to the Morropon province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Misael makes his living in the transport business, driving the Morropon to Santo Domingo line. He already has 5 years of experience in doing this. The credit will be used to repair and maintenance his vehicle, which he uses for transport, and this will help him to obtain higher revenue.

The market has good potential now, because the area no longer has daily rain showers, which allows for a lot of outputs from Santo Domingo.

loans.use: to repair and maintenance the vehicle he uses for transport, which will help him obtain higher revenue.

loans.name: Jesus Andalecio

texts.es:
Jesús Andalecio tiene 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su conyugue y sus 3 menores hijos de edades 16, 9, 2 años de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria y el otro primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de San Felipe. Jesús Andalecio vive por más de 16 años en la parte rural del distrito de San Felipe contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho dsitrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Jesús Andalecio es el cultivo y venta de lima, cuenta con clientela propia, asi como compradores del distrito de San Felipe. Su negocio se encuetra ubicado en el anexo de Chafan del distrito de San Felipe. Jesús Andalecio cuenta con un aproximado de 12 años dedicandose a esta actividad. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en compra de abonos para su parcela el cual le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Jesús Andalecio is 39 years old. He lives in his own house made of rudimentary materials with his spouse and their three young children, ages 16, 9, and 2, of which the first is in secondary school and the other is in primary at the national school of the district of San Felipe. Jesús Andalecio has lived for more than 16 years in the rural part of the San Felipe district, relying on the services of water and light. Said district is located in the Jaén province, Cajamarca Region, the north mountain of Peru.

The job that Jesús Andalecio carries out is the cultivation and sale of lines. He has his own clientele, like buyers of the district of San Felipe. His business can be found located in the annex of Chafan of the San Felipe district. Jesús Andalecio has spent approximately 12 years working at this job. The end use of the loan will be to invest in the purchase of manure for his plot, which will produce better income and in this way he can improve his quality of life. For this line of work there isn't a better competitor in the zone and with that, he gets better prices.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of manure for his plot

loans.name: Ericson

texts.en: Ericson is 20 years old, single, and a student taking up his Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. He has a strong determination to finish his education despite poverty. His mother operates a store for income while her spouse is a farmer. In order to pursue his education, Ericson is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to pay for tuition fees and school allowances. This loan will help for the realization of his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and school allowances.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old, married and has five children. 

Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gloria has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
This is Jinky. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jinky hopes to grow and expand her business so that she can cater to more of her customers' needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of mineral water to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear like t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc., to sell to her customers for her business.

Nila has been in this business for six years. Nila earns more income from fish vending.

Nila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear like t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc., to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and pay the qualified laborers to help assist with her coffee crops

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda de 44  años de edad vive con su esposo, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en su casa ubicada en un de San Lorenzo  donde vende  sus  golosinas  y  también las manda a vender de manera ambulante en los lugares  donde transitan muchas personas.
Doña Esmeralda solicita un préstamo para la compra de azúcar, café, mayonesa, mostaza, condimentos, leña, pan de barra, salsa, pollo, lácteos etc. Ya que desea expandir mas su negocio  y  de esa manera  espera tener más ganancias y así seguir apoyando a su familia, es su primer crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Su  sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del  2014.
texts.en:
Señora Esmeralda is 44 years old and lives with her husband. She has no dependent children. She lives in her house located in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, where she sells her candies, and she also sends them out for sale by street vendors in places where a lot of people circulate.

Doña Esmeralda is applying for a loan to purchase sugar, coffee, mayonnaise, mustard, condiments, firewood, baguettes, salsa, chicken, dairy products, etc., since she wants to expand her business more, and in this way she hopes to have more earnings and thus continue supporting her family. This is the first loan she has applied for at Prisma.

Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras   August  2014.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, mayonnaise, mustard, condiments, firewood, baguettes, salsa, chicken, dairy products, etc. for her business

loans.name: Shozie

texts.en: Shozie is 36 and is married with five children. He manages his own farm to make a living. He grows bananas and sells them in town, earning well for his family. With his income, he is able to support the family. He used this loan to buy organic fertilizers such as manure. He is thankful to GDMPC for helping him improve his farm in order to restore farm nutrients. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo dependiente, vive con su hijo y su conyugue; en el caserío de Agua Blanca; en dicho caserío la población se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de café. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el dsitrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Orlando se dedica a la cria y engorde de ganado, hace más de 10 años. Desea crédito para invertir en la compra de ganado flaco engordalo y luego venderlo. Orlando posee invernas donde engordar su ganado y posee conocimiento en el negocio y con esto logrará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is 36 years old, and is a common-law husband. He has one dependent child; he lives with his child and his spouse in the small village of Agua Blanca. In said village, the population works in agriculture, principally the cultivation of coffee. Said village is located in the Colasay district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, north mountain of Peru.

Orlando works in the rearing and fattening of cattle, and has for more than ten years. He want the loan to invest in the purchase of thin cattle, fatten them up, and later sell them. Orlando has good pastures where he can fatten his cattle, and he has knowledge in the business, and with this he will attain better income, better earnings, and so an improvement in the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of thin cattle, fatten them up, and then sell them

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 48 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, etc.

Adela has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Adela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, etc.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 51 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Lerma has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Lerma requested a PHP 19500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Lerma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lerma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Niña Rica

texts.en: Niña Rica is 18 years old, from Amulung, Cagayan. She is the eldest daughter among five siblings. She is taking up Elementary Education and wants to become a teacher someday. To attain her dreams, her parents must continue to support her education needs. Since her parents' income is not stable, she is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to pay tuition fees and daily allowances at school. She promises to pay her loan with the help of her supportive parents.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and daily school allowances.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, chips, noodles, etc.

Susan has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF in order to buy more snack foods to sell in her food stall.

Caroline has been in this business for five years. Caroline earns more income from pig fattening.

Caroline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rachel Ann

texts.en:
Rachel Ann works hard to support her family. Rachel Ann is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rachel Ann requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rachel Ann has been in this business for 5 years now.

Rachel Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 36 years old and married. She was blessed with six children. They are currently living in a rural community. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she engages in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables to supplement her husband's income. She wants to continue and improve her business but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more squash, sweet potatoes, bananas, cabbages, beans and leafy vegetables to resell. 

Being a kind and hard working mother, she believes that she will improve her business and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more squash, sweet potatoes, bananas, cabbages, beans and leafy vegetables to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marissa is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda is 32 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, spices, etc.

Creselda has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loads and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, spices, etc

loans.name: Enma Yohana

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una pastelería de su comunidad.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. Enma de tan solo 19 años de edad soltera y vive con sus padres a tomando el reto de la vida no como un obstáculo sino una oportunidad de poder demostrar a las demás personas de que si se puede superar en la vida.

La actividad que Enma realiza con todo empeño todos los días es trabajar en una pastelería para así llevar ese rico sabor al paladar de las personas que visitan dicha pastelería, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante cinco años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es realizar limpieza en la escuela de la comunidad donde ella vive para poder tener un ingreso extra para apoyar a su familia.

El uso respectivo que Enma dará al crédito gestionado es para la compra de una computadora para poder seguir estudiando y convertirse en profesional en su comunidad. Una de las  más grandes aspiraciones de Enma es seguir estudiando en la universidad para así conseguir un mejor empleo y ayudar a sus padres en los ingresos económicos para poder tener una vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Life gave her an opportunity to work as an employee in a pastry shop in her community. It was what she hoped for, not only an open door but what was behind that door. And what she found was something that defined what she wanted to be. Emma, who is only 19 years old, is single and lives with her parents. She has taken the challenge of life not as an obstacle but as an opportunity to be able to show others what can be overcome in life.

The work that Emma does each day with all her effort is working in a pastry shop to thus bring this rich taste to the palate of the people who visit this pastry shop. She has been doing this work for five years. Her second job is doing cleaning in the school in the community where she lives, in order to be able to have extra income to support her family.

The use that Emma will give to the loan transacted is to buy a computer in order to be able to continue studying and become a professional in her community. One of Emma's greatest aspirations is to continue studying at the university in order to thus get a better job and help her parents with the economic income to be able to have a good life.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
Ma. Heidi has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She also has been operating her own house rental business for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. The couple had to work hard, with the determination to have a better income to provide their children with a better education, that they don't currently have. 

To improve her profit, Ma. Heidi would like to apply for a new loan for the maintenance of the apartment. An amount of PHP 12,000 could already help her in the renovation and beautification of their place so that they could attract more boarders. She will also utilize the loan to add to the capital needed for her manicure and pedicure service. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ma. Heidi hopes to extend her apartment or even buy and manage another house for rent. She also hopes to have additional sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens.  Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 50 years old and married with eight children.

Nelfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Nelfa has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from food vending.

Nelfa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Pamela Rose

texts.en:
Pamela Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Pamela Rose has been in this business for three years. Pamela Rose earns additional income from pig fattening.

Pamela Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Vasilyi

texts.ru:
Василий — из Берегово. Ему 54 года, он женат, двое взрослых детей. Работает охранником на заводе. Семья Василия живет в собственном одноэтажном доме. В комнатах давно делали побелку, стены стали грязными, потрескались. Пол сырой из-за влажности в доме. Более того, в самом доме нет туалета — он на улице. 
Василий надеется вложить полученные от КИВА средства в размере 20 000 гривен в  улучшение жилищных условий своей семьи. Василий хочет побелить стены дома, положить на пол ламиинат и плитку, сделать в доме туалет. Все эти усовершенствования помогут сделать дом уютнее и теплее перед холодным зимним сезоном. Все ремонтные работы Василий выполняет самостоятельно.
texts.en:
Vasilyi is from Beregovo.  He is 54 years old, married, and the father of two adult children.  He works as a security guard in a factory.  He and his family own their home, a one-story house.  It's been a long time since the rooms have been repainted, the walls have become dirty and cracked.  The floor is always damp because of the humidity in the house.  But most importantly, there is no toilet in the house.  Toilet is outside.

With his 20,000 hryvnia loan from Kiva, Vasilyi is planning to improve his family's living conditions.  He wants to whitewash the walls, cover the floor with tiles and laminate flooring, and install a toilet.  All these improvements will make the house more comfortable and also warmer during the winter months.  Vasilyi will take care of all repairs and improvements by himself.

loans.use: to whitewash the walls, cover the floors with laminate flooring, and build a toilet inside his house.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona, is aged 33, married to a government employee and blessed with 1 child. 

She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost eleven years and earns a net income of PHP 600 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient funds she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, and beverages. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is a married woman with two children. Nelfa is 54 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelfa has a buy and sell, ready to wear business in the Philippines. Nelfa requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear clothes to sell.

Nelfa has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Nelfa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 2 years. Lilibeth earns additional income from rice vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for insurance, office expenses, gas and marketing materials

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 47 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Magdalena has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loads.

Magdalena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. Jessica has a live-in partner and has a fish and dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jessica requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and dried fish to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 1 year now.

Jessica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva has always been a saleswoman and an entrepreneur. At age nine, she started selling gum, fruit, whatever the item for sale that day was, on the streets of San Pedro Sula in Honduras. She moved to the United States as an adult nine years ago and worked as a cashier. Eventually she became a manager for a grocery store in Florida. When she first moved to Louisiana five years ago, she got a job as a hotel housekeeper. But, she said, being a salesperson is so much more interesting. “I prefer to be around people because I like talking with people,” she said.
 
So, she opened her own business, Mancia’s Services, at the local flea market in Gretna, where she shopped over the weekends. She has been selling gold jewelry, clothing and perfume at her stall for almost five years. In recent years, she said, one of the most popular items she has sold has been a type of breathable underwear for men made of Lycra. “As soon as I put them out for sale, they sell out quickly,” she said. “And the other vendors at the flea market have asked me to buy them some, too.” So, Eva had the idea to become the exclusive distributor of these boxers, selling them to vendors that serve Spanish-speaking customers in Louisiana.  Though she had clients already lined up, and knew this idea would lead to definite profits, Eva lacked the capital to make a large purchase. Fortunately, while she was driving and listening to her favorite radio station, 1540 AM, she heard an advertisement for Accion Louisiana – an extension of Accion Texas.

“I am so grateful to Accion,” Eva said. “I have had so many negative experiences with people who have offered bad advice to Spanish speakers and taken advantage of Spanish speakers. And this was the first time I had some helpful advice and assistance. Everybody has been so wonderful.”

Eva used her loan from Accion Louisiana to make a large purchase of merchandise, particularly the Lycra boxers. She said her plans for the future include continuing to expand all aspects of her business, from sales to distribution, and eventually opening her own store.

loans.use: To make a large purchase of inventory

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles started out as an affiliate in marketing, selling other companies’ products.  After researching market trends, he decided to invest in the beauty industry. Operating out of Lumberton, Mississippi, he created Izy Trends. The company is in its first few months of development and Charles plans to grow Izy Trends into an online sensation. 

“The beauty industry is huge,” Charles said. “I know this is something we can really grow into.” His product lineup began with an eyelash curler and will soon develop into a one-stop shop for all things beauty. Charles is currently researching additional products he would like to add to his online store. With over two years of marketing experience, he is thrilled to be developing his e-commerce website. 
 
Charles is grateful that his wife is able to help him with the accounting side of the business and uses her keen eye when it comes to choosing which beauty products to add to the product lineup. “I have seen my wife’s beauty routine and I know the lengths women will go to look their best,” Charles said. “My wife and I are looking forward to building this business together.”

His main focus is to build his web presence, driving online shoppers to his site. In addition to Facebook, Charles is investing in a “pay per click” marketing strategy, a popular way for search engines like Bing and Google to allow businesses to buy listings within their search results. Twitter will be his next goal after learning how to manage his current advertising methods. 

Charles came to Accion Texas Inc. to purchase the inventory he needs to support his e-commerce development. He is also purchasing tracking tools to help him evaluate which advertisements are the most successful for his company.ssws 

“I am just getting my feet wet, but I know there are unlimited opportunities for me to really do well,” Charles said.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Manap

texts.en:
Meet Manap. Manap and his family live in South Bogor, a southern part of Bogor regency located about less than an hour's drive from Jakarta. Manap has two children, both of whom are going to school. He runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits.

Manap was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. Manap is excited because not only does using technology makes the business run easier, he can also learn how to improve his shop from Ruma staff. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile services for his community on the weekends. Manap is pictured in the photo sitting in his small shop, showing the mobile airtime catalogue. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 39-year-old woman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She is married with four children ages 6 to 20. Together with her husband, Mary Jane has been in the fishing business to provide for their children. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy rope, fishing nets and fishing weights.

Mary Jane is optimistic about the future regardless of the challenge from the past caused by typhoon Haiyan. She perseveres and hopes that the loan will pave the way to the recovery of her livelihood. Her income will be for the school fees of her children and a healthy diet for her family.

loans.use: to buy rope, fishing nets and fishing weights

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 41 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are in school.

Maricar is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricar has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sokha Group

texts.en:
Sokha is 33 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a worker cutting firewood for a fee and she has been in this work since 2001. Her husband is 29 and is also a worker cutting firewood. Both of her children are students. They live in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $12.50 a day. 

Now Sokha would like to request a loan to buy foundation parts for a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family a hygienic living. In the future, she is going to have an additional business, renovate her house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts for a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the vehicle she needs for catering

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Ruby works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling roasted whole pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ruby is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pigs for her business selling roasted whole pigs.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for her business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Due to hardship of living, Nena aimed to improve her small retail store to earn a higher income. 

She is 51 years old and blessed with six adult-age children. She and her husband aspire to improve their standard of living and give their children a better life. Having insufficient capital, Nena would like financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil, salt, canned goods, beverages, eggs, soft drinks, candies and breads to resell. 

She is hoping that someday, she will further improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil, salt, canned goods, beverages, eggs, soft drinks, candies and breads to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria owns and operates a jeepney unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 20,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy other materials needed in her business.

In the future, Apolinaria dreams of buying an additional jeepney unit for transportation service. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Mety

texts.en: Mety and her family live in South Bogor, a southern part of Bogor regency located less than an hour's drive from Jakarta. Mety's husband is an employee in a private company. Contributing to the family income, Mety runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to expand her network, learn how to use technology, and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. She feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile services in her community on weekends. In the future, she is planning to expand her business and continue to provide services to her community. Mety is pictured in the photo sitting in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 59 years old and married with four children.

Angela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Angela has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Angela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like chips, coffee, eggs, milk, etc.

Susan has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like chips, coffee, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 58 años de edad, viuda, tiene un hijo y su negocio es la venta de comida típica.
Ella es emprendedora, amable, sensible, sincera, generosa, comprensiva paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en Sacaba que se encuentra situada en el centro del país, localizada en el valle del mismo nombre en medio de la Cordillera de los Andes, es la capital del departamento de Cochabamba y es considerada como la capital de los valles de Bolivia, se encuentra en una tierra fértil y productiva a 2.570 metros sobre el nivel del mar, rodeada por campos de cultivos y valiosos vestigios preincaicos, conserva su semblante colonial y las costumbres que heredó de sus antepasados indígenas.
Isabel es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es la quechua que lo combina con español según sus necesidades de comercio. Su negocio es la venta de comida, que son platos típicos del lugar; famosa por sus manjares de carne de conejo cuy, el lambreado de conejo, chicharrón de cerdo, charquekan de carne de llama o de res, puchero, lawas, lluspichi, chairo, carbonada de zapallo, ají de arvejas, habas pejtu. Además de los platos de pato y lapping. Todo va acompañado con su chicha (bebida alcohólica a base de maíz fermentado).
Ella sueña expandir su negocio realizando la compra de un freezer y una cocina, para ayudar a su hijo a pagar los gastos de sus estudios superiores.
Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de un freezer y cocina y con los beneficios ayudar a su hijo a finalizar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 58-year-old woman. She is a widow and has one son. Her business is the sale of traditional food.

She is enterprising, friendly, sensitive, sincere, generous, understanding, patient, supportive, strong, responsible, and very hardworking, as well as being a good listener and a good mother. She does her work in Sacaba, which is situated in the center of the country, located in the valley of the same name in the middle of the Andes mountain range. It is the capital of the department of Cochabamba and is considered to be the capital of the valleys of Bolivia. It is located on fertile, productive land 2,570 meters above sea level, surrounded by fields of crops and valuable pre-Incan ruins. It maintains its colonial appearance and the customs passed down by its indigenous forefathers.

Isabel has dark skin and long, braided, black hair. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which she combines with Spanish according to her business needs. Her business is the sale of food, namely traditional regional dishes. She is famous for her guinea pig meat delicacies, "lambreado de conejo" [fried, breaded guinea pig], "chicharrones de cerdo" [pork ribs boiled and cooked in fat], "charquekan" [a dried beef or llama meat dish], "puchero" [a chickpea and meat stew], "lawas" [thick, creamy soups], "lluspichi" [thick wheat soup], "chairo" [vegetable beef stew], "carbonada de zapallo" [squash stew], "ají de arvejas" [peas in chili pepper sauce], and "habas peitu" [a lima bean dish], in addition to the duck and flank steak dishes. Everything is accompanied by chicha, an alcoholic fermented-corn-based drink.

She dreams of expanding her business by purchasing a freezer and a stove, so that she can help her son to pay his higher education expenses. This is why Isabel is requesting a loan for the purchase of a freezer and a stove in order to use the earnings to help her son finish his higher education.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a stove, and with the earnings, to help her son to finish his higher education.

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es:
Jose Feliciano tiene 41 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero. Vive en la casa de su madre, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz); vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú. Él es natural de la zona. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y al comercio de platano.

La actividad que desarrolla Jose Feliciano es el transporte de platano desde las chacras hasta los camiones, él realiza esta actividad mediante sus caballos o en su motofurgoneta. El destino del crédito es para mejoras mecánicas de su motocarga, para cancelar las cuotas de financiera Crediscotia y el restante de dinero lo invertirá en un negocio que se le a presentado: Compra de lote de leña, la que transportará, almacenará y luego la comercializará; lo que le permitirá venderla a un mejor precio; aumentando sus ingresos, mejoras en su ganancias y por consecuente una mejroa en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Feliciano, 41, is single and lives in his mother´s house.  The house is equipped with basic utilities such as water and electricity.  They live in the Buenos Aires district in the province of Morropon.  This is located in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.  

Jose was born here in this small community, where most people dedicate their time to raising livestock and the banana trade.

Jose transports bananas from the fields to the trucks.  He does this using his horses and a motorcycle trailer.

He will use the loan to make some mechanical repairs on his motorcycle trailer as well as paying off a previous loan with Crediscotia.  

He will then use the money left over to invest in a new business.  This is to buy firewood in bulk which he will then transport and store to be sold at a later date.  Doing this now will allow him to sell at a profit, which will increase his income.  These extra profits will help him improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle trailer, pay off a previous loan and invest in firewood.

loans.name: Muhammad Junaidi

texts.en:
Junaidi is a farmer who lives in Kudus, Central Java. In history, Kudus was an important holy city in the 16th century in Indonesia. Junaidi is married and he lives with his wife in the family home. To increase the family income, he runs a small stall that sells bird supplies and equipment such as birdcages and bird food. 

He joined Ruma about six months ago because he wanted to try the mobile airtime business. He is very excited to sell mobile airtime because it is such a great opportunity to provide mobile services in his community. Most of his farmer friends already own mobile phones. As the business continues to run, Junaidi hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile services to his community on the weekends. Junaidi is pictured in the photo sitting in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process mobile airtime credits on the weekends

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Habiba works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Habiba is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing boat and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Habiba has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing boat and other fishing materials

loans.name: Marina
