He he requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 nuevos soles for the purchase of metallic products to stock his store with more raw material and to be able to fulfill the orders he has pending, which will allow him to augment his income, improving his earning and consequently his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: stock more raw material to be able to fulfill the orders he has pending

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a minimart and buy: snacks, juices, water, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase other amounts of good quality and stylish ready-made clothes

loans.name: 23 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “23 DE JULIO” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fanny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: kiosco de dulces, tienda de barrio, venta de material de limpieza, costura de deportivos, venta de cosméticos, ganadería, venta de bisutería, venta de cotillones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fanny es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de cotillones; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace diez años, al observar a  su cuñada la elaboración de los productos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de piñatas por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la frontera Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará a en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos accesibles que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The  A.C. (communal bank) “23 DE JULIO”will enter is 17th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Community Center.  It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Fanny is the president. The businesses that the members engage in are varied and include: a candy kiosk; neighborhood store; cleaning supplies sales; sewing of athletic clothing; cosmetics sales; livestock; costume jewelry sales; party goods sales.  

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Fanny is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling party goods and explains that she started the business on her own initiative ten years ago when she saw her sister-in-law making these products. The loan she is now seeking is to increase capital to buy piñatas at wholesale at the Peru/Bolivia border fairs. She will later sell them at her stand.  

This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the accessibility of the loans offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy pinatas at wholesale.

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Leina is a mother of five births, two sets of twins and one alone (two sons and three daughters), all of whom are at school. She is in her 40's and married. 

For six years now, she has been supporting her family by running several businesses, the first of which was a mamalishe (open food vendor), which with good management, produced other two projects. Liquid and powered soaps and a shop selling fabrics, and Muslim-type of dresses and shoes are the other two businesses. She works hard, from 06 am to 08 pm daily, and is able to make a very good profit each month. 

This is her fourth loan request via Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. With her new request, she will invest it to buy business inventory.

Leina used the previous credits, since repaid, to open the two projects away from mamalishe and bought rice, vegetables, maize and baking flour, sugar, etc. She managed to receive an extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. 

Leina dreams that one day she will be able to grow her businesses more and be successful. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Muheza", which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business inventory.

loans.name: Ma. Lulieta

texts.en:
Ma. Lulieta is 54 years old and married. She has three children.  

Ma. Lulieta is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Lulieta has been farming vegetables for 25 years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Ma. Lulieta requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Ma. Lulieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as iron, steel, bricks, and cement

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина — предприниматель из Павлограда. Она торгует на главном местном рынке постельными принадлежностями: наборами постельного белья, подушками, полотенцами, одеялами. Торговая точка давно ею выкуплена. Опыт работы составляет более 20 лет. Ирина — большой оптимист, несмотря на непростое положение украинских предпринимателей сейчас, держится и на кризис не жалуется. 
На сумму в 10 000 гривен она планиурет закупить товар и пополнить его ассортимент у себя на точке. Она хочет приобрести партию комплектов постельного белья, одеял, покрывал и подушек.
texts.en:
Irina is a businesswoman from Pavlograd. She sells linens at the local market, including bedding, pillows, towels and blankets. She has over twenty years of experience. Irina is very much an optimist in spite of the difficult situation for Ukrainian businesses, and she does not complain about the crisis. 
She plans to use 10,000 hryvnia to buy merchandise and replenish her inventory at the shop. She wants to buy bedsheets, blankets, bedspreads and pillows.

loans.use: to purchase linens, blankets and pillows to sell

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
Allahverdi is 37 years old and is married with 2 children. The eldest of his children is going to second grade while the other child will go to school next year. They are living in the Baku region. 

Allahverdi has been in the animal breeding business for 15 years.  He buys little calves, fattens and then sells them. His wife helps Allahverdi with this family business. 

A while ago, Allahverdi applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 1,550 AZN. With this loan, he wants to buy calves. He is thankful for the help from the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to pay for calves.

loans.name: Red Apple Group

texts.en:
Rahma, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three daughters who are still at school.  She has been running a grocery store for five years now.  She work from 06 am to midnight daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Rahma's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy a cooking stove, tables, and more drinks for the grocery store.  She dreams of improving her grocery store.

Rahma will share this loan with her loan group, "RED APPLE", which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a cooking stove, tables, and more drinks for the grocery store.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Lilibeth has been engaged in a vegetable vending business to supplement her husband's income. She is 28 years old and has two schooling children. She aims to make her business profitable in order to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of her children. 

She wants to acquire more stock of vegetables to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more stock of pechay, beans, cabbages, squash, tomatoes, eggplants, okra and bitter melon to sell. 

With this financial assistance, Lilibeth believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of pechay, beans, cabbages, squash, tomatoes, eggplants, okra and bitter melon

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Charisse

texts.en:
Charisse works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Charisse requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Charisse would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, cotton, shampoo, candies, soaps, perfumes, cigarettes, and other things Including soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Samanthipoo Shg - Suthamalli Group

texts.en:
Rajakumari (with hand raised) is a 52-year-old married woman with two children. Rajakumari’s husband is a marginal farmer with an average income.

Rajakumari has learned of a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra that uses 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Most members in her community use conventional firewood stoves in their kitchens, which cause 70% more smoke emissions than smokeless stoves. Rajakumari wishes to be able to save money on fuel expenses as well as to provide a good atmosphere in the house, devoid of caustic fumes.

Rajakumari is a leader of the Samanthipoo Self-Help Group (SHG), which is located in Suthamalli village of Ariyalur District in Tamil Nadu, India. She and the other 10 members of the group wish to request a group loan in order to buy this smokeless stove. They all are hoping to benefit from the lower fuel costs and safety of lower smoke emissions.       
 
This is Samanthipoo group’s very first loan from Kiva. The group members are very excited about the opportunity to purchase this sustainable stove and wish to thank the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Cheliamman Shg - Anaikudam Group

texts.en:
Pazhaniyammal (with hand raised) leads a group called Cheliamman of 12 other women residing in the Anaikudam village of Ariyalur district in Tamil Nadu. Pazhaniyammal is the featured borrower. They are all married, and to support their family incomes and meet their monthly expenditures, they have to work. They are hardworking women. 

For cooking, Pazhaniyammal, like the others, mostly uses the traditional chulha, a makeshift stove that uses firewood, which emits a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among family members, but also pollutes their surroundings. 
 
Pazhaniyammal, like the other members, is seeking a loan to purchase a Greenway cooking stove. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. 

The group intends to repay the loan amount in easy installments. This loan product will help them in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless cooking stove.

loans.name: Sivasakthi Shg - Suthamalli Group

texts.en:
Sivasakthi Self-Help Group is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT). This NGO helps people improve their livelihood in Tamil Nadu.   
 
Megala is the leader of this group (with hand raised), which contains 15 more members. She lives in Suthamalli village, Ariyalur District, in her own house with her husband and two children. Her husband is a farmer. 
 
Megala has been taking loans for the last three years from PAT, and has repaid the loans on time.  

Megala wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt., Ltd. Its cost is 1,400 INR. It is designed for daily use. The traditional stoves produce more smoke and are called kitchen killers. The smokeless stove emits less carbon dioxide and prevents household risk. It also promotes healthier lifestyles by limiting the toxic and hazardous effects of indoor pollution.   

Megala, like the other members, is requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove to give a healthier life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to him as he was able to purchase additional stocks of LPG tanks needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for additional stocks of LPG tanks needed in his business. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ferdinand hopes to have a significant increase in sales and also in clients for he wants to give his family a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partner /clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Jaymar

texts.en:
Jaymar is 19 years old. He is the third child of Marites. Jaymar is a college student taking up Bachelor of Arts in Public Administration. He wants to finish his education and have good employment so he can help his parents someday. To achieve this, he needs continuous financial support.

Jaymar is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay his tuition fees. He promises to pay back his loan in full and continue to become a responsible student.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estelita is 62 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Estelita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Estelita has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing/fish vending.  Josephine is borrowing 6,000 PHP, through NWTF, to purchase more vegetables to sell at her vegetable vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for her kids. 

Sophia operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 2 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Sophia dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 31 years old and has four children. Lucille is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Lucille is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucille requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucille has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucille would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lydia has been in this business for 25 years now.

Lydia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with no children. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours, pupils, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mary dreams of establishing a cafe business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for her food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for her food preparation.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is a mother of two daughters, one schooling and the other grown. She is in her 40s and married. Zuhura runs a shop selling water wholesale and another selling dry food and drinks, beers, sodas and juices. She has been in these businesses for three years now and is able to make a good monthly profit. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. per working day.

Zuhura has been with Tujijenge Tanzania for more than ten loan cycles, all of which she paid back successfully. She is so trustful, always paying well her loans. Zuhura is so thankful to everyone who supported her group. Her business now is improved to the extent that she can manage to add other items (like drinks and clothes). She used the previous loan cycles to replenish water stocks and opened the shop selling food. She received profit that she used to plow back to her business. She also bought home a TV and cupboards, both for the kitchen and for cloth keeping. She paid part of the school fees and home food expenses.  

Zuhura's dream is to manage a nice family house and for her child to attain high education level. 

She will use her new credit request to buy a business freezer and drinks for her shop. She will share this loan with her loan group, Mapatano, which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a business freezer and drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, es propietaria de un negocio de elaboración y comercialización de piezas de loza, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, juntos colaboran para tener un ambiente familiar en armonía; su madre le enseño a trabajar el barro como una forma de tener ingresos para subsistir, el negocio funciona desde hace 30 años, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., su venta ja es la calidad de sus productos y la preferencia de sus clientes.
Invertirá en la materia prima para elaborar piezas de loza, comprara barro crudo, arcilla, nacazcol, pintura entre otros materiales que le permitan trabajar y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, de esta manera busca aumentar la productividad del negocio para tener mayores ventas y ganancias, las que serán de utilidad para cubrir sus necesidades familiares y resarcir su deuda.
Sus sueños son expandir su negocio para ofrecer un futuro con mejores oportunidades de desarrollo para su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and three children, and they work together to have a harmonious family atmosphere.

She owns a business making and selling pottery.  Her mother taught her to work with clay as a form of income to survive.  She has had the business for 30 years.  Her work schedule is 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.  Her advantage is the quality of her products and her customers' preference.

María will invest in raw materials to make pottery.  She'll buy raw clay, clay, "nacazcol" [a type of dye], paint, and other materials so she can work and fill her customers' orders.  She hopes to increase her business productivity and have better sales and earnings, which will help her cover family's necessities and pay back her debt.

Her dream is to expand her business so she can give her family a future with better growth opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clay, dye, and paint

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has two children who are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Lucy dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sheet metal, wood and nails to repair her kitchen and the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to finish building a wall around the perimeter of her house.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
Apolinario, siente que la institución lo apoya en llevar acabo sus cultivos de manera inmediata, por lo que nuevamente solicita un préstamo para comprar fóliales, insecticidas, abono y semilla, para continuar sembrando granos básicos, mejorará cada día la alimentación de su familia y resarcirá su deuda.
Don Apolinario manifiesta que con ayuda de préstamos ha mantenido su negocio funcionando, las ganancias le permiten subsistir  con su familia y cubrir las cuotas de la deuda.
texts.en:
Apolinario feels that the institution supports him in caring for his crops right away, which is why he is applying for a loan again to buy fertilizers, insecticides, compost, and seeds, in order to continue planting basic grains. His family's diet will improve everyday, and he will repay his debt.

Apolinario says that with the help of loans, he has kept his business going. The earnings allow him to survive with his family and to cover the loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, compost, and seeds, in order to continue planting basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy:  corn, beans, mango, papaya, pineapple, watermelon, etc.

loans.name: Janeth Marlene

texts.es: Janeth de 28 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como jornalera en una finca cercana a su vivienda, aunque se conoce como un trabajo pesado, ella se desenvuelve muy bien, ya que es la única fuente de empleo cercana, y lo que le permite a portar a la economía familiar. Janeth desea construir una vivienda humilde de lámina para tener un lugar propio donde vivir, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para ello, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para construir su vivienda de lámina.
texts.en:
Janeth, 28 years old, lives with her life partner and her two children, 12 and 5 years old. She is an enterprising woman who works as a day laborer on a farm close to her home. Although the work is known for being difficult, she manages very well, since it is the only nearby source of employment and it allows her to contribute to family finances.

Janeth would like to build a modest metal house in order to have her own place to live, but she doesn't have the necessary financial resources for it. That is why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in: metal sheets, wood, and nails in order to build her metal house.

loans.use: to invest in:  metal sheets, wood, and nails to build her metal house.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 27 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Liezel is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Liezel has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman who lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water. 

For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural business, selling produce from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 25,000 KES she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Lux Charmaine

texts.en:
Lux Charmaine is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Lux Charmaine works very hard to provide for them.

Lux Charmaine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like fabric conditioner, canned goods, milk, soft-drinks, beer, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell.

Lux Charmaine has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as fabric conditioner, canned goods, milk, soft-drinks, beer, shampoo, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Lux Charmaine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like fabric conditioner, canned goods, milk, soft-drinks, beer, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air, food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 15,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra de 20 años de edad es soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y hermano. Ella es una joven trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, además su hermano también aporta a la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo de jornalero. Sandra desea reparar el techo del corredor de su vivienda, que como se puede observar en la fotografía está a punto de caerse, además desea construir un muro para darle más seguridad a su vivienda, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, polines y pines para reparar el techo del corredor y construir un muro en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra, 20, is single and lives with her mother and brother in a home that they own.  She is a hardworking young woman who earns a living as a housekeeper.  She has worked in this field for four years.  Her brother also helps with the family finances through his work as a day laborer.  

Sandra wishes to repair the hallway roof in her home, which as can be seen in the photograph, is on the verge of falling down.  She also wants to build a wall to provide greater security to her home.  For these reasons, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, purlins and pins to repair the hallway roof and build the wall.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, purlins and pins to repair the hallway ceiling and build a wall in her home.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan de 40 años de edad habita en  vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 13, 12 y 11 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como albañil independiente, además tratando de mejorar  las condiciones de vida de su familia, se desempeña como vendedor de una venta de electrodomésticos. Juan desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que las lluvias están deteriorando sus pertenencias es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan, 40, lives with his wife and their three children, ages 13, 12 and 11, in a home that they own.  He is a hardworking man who works as an independent mason.  Additionally, in order to improve his family's living conditions, he works selling household appliances.

Juan wants to replace the roof of his home because it is currently in need of repair because the rain has damaged their belongings.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase sheet metal, wood and nails to replace the roof of his home.

loans.use: purchase sheet metal, wood and nails to replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 20 años de edad. Él es un hombre que todos los días pone su esfuerzo y esmero para sacar adelante a su familia, apoyado en su trabajo como albañil independiente, por el cual es muy solicitado por su honestidad y experiencia, ya que se dedica a este oficio desde hace 22 años. Marco desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda y encementar el piso de la misma por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, lamina y pines para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marco, 52, lives with his wife and their 20 year old son in a house that they own.  He is a man who everyday puts forth his effort and dedication to get his family ahead.  He works as an independent mason for which he is highly sought after due to his honesty and experience.  He has dedicated himself to this business for 22 years.

Marco wants to replace the roof of his home and cement the floor of his home, which is why he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, sheet metal and nails to complete the necessary work.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, sheet metal and nails to replace his roof and cement the floor of his home.

loans.name: Qumru

texts.en:
Qumru is a 63 year-old married refugee. She has two beautiful daughters and two sons and they all live in IDP settlement. She is a farmer and has been raising fruits and vegetables for 30 years. She sells her harvest at the local bazaar and her husband helps her in this. He gets additional earnings working as a laborer in his free time. The family gets 250AZN monthly from selling the harvest, and this is not enough to cover demands.
The place where Qumru lives has a dry climate and she needs to build a greenhouse for fruits and vegetables. She applied for a 1500AZN loan in order to buy good garden tools and hire workers for building a greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy good garden tools and hire workers for building greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as cane in order to continue making her bags and supporting her family.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and has six children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. Vilma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for 1one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Corazon is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Corazon has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nippers, nail cutters, etc. for her business.

Corazon has been in this business for one year. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nippers, nail cutters, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of natural medicines at wholesale.

loans.name: Saphal

texts.en:
Saphal is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has two dependent children who are currently in school and she also has two married children. She lives in a small village of Battambang Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for twenty one years with an average income of USD 5.00 per day.

Saphal wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, rafters, cement, sand and gravel to construct a kitchen and to provide it with a cement floor.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pedrita is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Pedrita has a general store business in the Philippines. Pedrita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Pedrita has been in this business for 3 years. Pedrita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Helconida

texts.en:
Helconida is 56 years old and married with one child.  

Helconida is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Helconida requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helconida has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Helconida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a business woman and most of her daily income is from selling second hand clothes. She has a shop for second hand clothes. 

She hopes to increase her business, but the money is not enough, so she is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will add it with her working capital to buy more second hand clothes including shorts, pants, shirts, short-sleeved shirts, long sleeve shirts, children's clothes and other things to sell Including rice. She started selling second hand clothes in 2006 with her own working capital of $1000. She sells every day because many people are interested in her second hand clothes, and they come to buy every day. 

She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, shirts, short-sleeved shirts, long sleeve shirts, children's clothes and other things to sell Including rice.

loans.name: Mansura

texts.en:
Mansura is 34 years old and married with a daughter and a son. The members of her family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. She is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits for 12 years. Her husband is a laborer and helps her to drive to the nearest bazaar and sell fruit. The monthly income from the harvest is 210 AZN.

Raising and selling fruit and vegetables is hard work. Mansura takes care of the plants in hot and cold weather. Then her husband drives her with the harvest to the nearest local bazaar to sell the produce.

Farming is the only source of income for family but the income doesn’t cover family demands. Additionally the car they use for driving is old and needs repairing. Mansura applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to repair her old car and be able to drive it to the local bazaar.

loans.use: to repair her old car and be able to drive to the local bazaar to sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Phearin

texts.en:
Phearin is 21 years old and a student at a university. His major is Civil Engineering. He lives with his parents in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. 

Because of a lack of financial support, Phearin would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees for a Bachelor’s Degree. This loan will help him graduate.

In the future, he wants to be a good engineer and build his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.ru:
Анатолию — 50 лет, он с семьей живет в собственном доме на 3 комнаты. Недавно он достроил небольшое помещение к дому и теперь хотел бы провести в нем ремонт. В планах Анатолия — покрытие крыши металопрофилем, установка металопластиковых дверей и окон, стяжка и штукатурка стен. 
Анатолию нужна сумма в 25 000 гривен для того, чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия, обустроив пристройку в своем доме.
texts.en: Anatolyi is 50 and lives with his family in a three-room house. He recently built a small addition to the house and would now like to renovate it. He plans to cover the roof with profiled metal, install reinforced plastic windows and doors, and plaster the walls. Anatolyi needs 25,000 hryvnia to improve his living conditions and complete the addition to his house.

loans.use: to renovate an addition to his house

loans.name: Nuri Maricela

texts.es: Nuri de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre de 63 años de edad y su sobrino de 19 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad va saliendo adelante, siempre apoyando a su madre y cuidando a su sobrino, y se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de manera domiciliar. Nuri desea terminar de construir el cuarto de la cocina y un dormitorio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir el cuarto de la cocina y un dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nuri is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her 63-year-old mother and her 19-year-old nephew. She always manages to get ahead owing to her efforts and tenacity, always supporting her mother and taking care of her nephew.

She makes a living performing domestic services in private homes. 

Nuri would like to finish building the kitchen and a bedroom in her home, therefore she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to finish the construction.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to finish building the kitchen and a bedroom in her home.

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es:
Jessica joven ecuatoriana nació en la ciudad de Latacunga tiene 18 años es soltera vive en casa propia con los padres y hermanos, no tiene hijos se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, este negocio lo aprendió desde muy chica a sus padres y familiares, ya que la mayoría se dedica a esta actividad, vive un una zona rural de la ciudad, sector muy conocido por la elaboración de bloque y chatarra, las ventas que realiza son en forma ambulante dentro y fuera de la ciudad.
Con el sacrificio de sus padres pudo concluir sus estudios hasta la secundaria y desde ahí tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar ya que por falta de recursos económicos se vió obligada a hacerlo para poder sustentar sus necesidades y ser un apoyo para sus padres, su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más.  
Hoy está solicitando un segundo crédito, el mismo que lo utilizará para la compra de mas chatarra que va a traer de la ciudad de Ambato.
Ella agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Jessica is a young 18 year old Ecuadorean who was born in the city of Latacunga. She is single and lives in her own house with her parents and siblings. She has no children.

She works buying and selling scrap which she learned at a young age from her parents and relatives, Most of them work in this business. She lives in a rural sector of the city an area known for it's production of cider blocks and scrap. She buys itinerantly inside the city and outside it.

With the sacrifice of her parents she completed her secondary studies but then she had to go to work. The lack of economic resources forced her to work to be able to support herself and be a help to her parents. Her small business has continually grown.

She is now requesting her second loan which she will use to buy more scrap which she will take to the city of Ambato. She is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva to make possible this growth in her personal and work life.

loans.use: to buy more scrap and increase his business.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 24 y 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza por llevar el pan de cada día a su vivienda, apoyado en su trabajo de albañil independiente. Marco carece de dos de los servicios básicos  de un hogar como son: energía eléctrica y agua potable, además desea construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre, interruptores, caja térmica, tubos PVC, grifos, cemento, arena y ladrillo para instalar energía eléctrica, agua potable y construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Marco is 44 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his two children aged 24 and 6 years old. He is a hard-working man who makes an effort to bring home the daily bread supported by his work as a independent bricklayer. Marco is missing two basic services at his house, electricity and running water and he also wants to build a septic tank for his house. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in wire, switches, thermal breaker, PVC tubing, facets, cement, sand, and bricks to instal electricity, potable water and build a septic tank for his house.

loans.use: to invest in wire, switches, thermal breaker, PVC tubing, facets, cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for personal transportation and to provide a transport service  to earn extra money.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: Anne marie est commerçante et vice présidente de la banque communautaire Amkeni, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 5 enfants, dont 2 scolarisés et 3 n’étudient plus. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle est vendeuse de divers habillements sur la rue mouvementée de la ville  depuis 12 ans. Elle va acheter 15 paires de souliers, 30 pantalons et 20 chemises.    Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs excluent du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Anne Marie is a a merchant and the vice-president of the community bank Amkeni. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 42 years old and the mother of five children, two in school and three no longer students. She started her business with funds from her husband when he was alive. Anne Marie has been a vendor of a variety of clothing on the town’s busy street for twelve years. She is going to purchase 15 pairs of shoes, 30 pants, and 20 shirts. She would like to obtain more loans and provide schooling and food for her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional baking system.

loans.use: to purchase chase 15 pairs of shoes, 30 pants, and 20 shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a gazebo and chairs for the wedding ceremonies she provides.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия заботливая мать 4 детей. Она родилась в 1964 году. Зулфия замужем. Она вместе со своей большой семьей живет дружно. Ее дети семейные. Зулфия с целью получения дохода, 3 месяца назад начала свой бизнес шитьем и продажей национального матраса «курпача». Она шьёт у себя дома и продает на местном рынке. Зулфия нуждается швейной машинке и большого стола для кройки. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и стол для кроя. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a caring mother of 4 children. She was born in 1964. Zulfiya is married. She lives happily with her big family. Her children have families too. Zulfiya started her own business in sewing and selling national mattresses, called "kurpacha," 3 months ago in order to earn an income. She sews at home and sells at a local market. Zulfiya needs a sewing machine and a large desk for cutting. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6500 somoni to buy a sewing machine and desk for cutting. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and desk for cutting

loans.name: Rene Ovidio

texts.es: René de 20 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su abuela de 69 años de edad y su grupo familiar. Él es un joven trabajador que se gana la vida como jornalero en una finca cercana a su vivienda, y es apoyado en ese trabajo que logra sostener la economía familiar. René desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, ya que actualmente ese es de tierra, por lo que al no contar con los fondos económicos necesarios, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
René, 20 years old, lives in his own home with his 69 year old grandmother and his family group. He is a hardworking youth who earns his living as a day laborer on a farm near his home. He depends on that work, which manages to support his family household.

René wants to install a concrete floor in his dwelling because now there is a dirt one.  As he does not have the necessary funds he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase cement, sand and gravel so he can lay a concrete floor in his home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel in order to install a concrete floor in his home.

loans.name: Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.fr: Mbubi est une femme ambitieuse et membre de la banque communautaire Tusonge Mbele, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un mécanicien, âgée de 30 ans, mère de 4 enfants, qui vont  tous à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de friperie dans un marché de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter 4 ballons d'habits. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mbubi is an ambitious woman and a member of the community bank Tusonge Mbele. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 30 years old, married to a mechanic, and the mother of four children, who all go to school. She started her business with funds from her husband. Mbubi has been a vendor of secondhand clothing at a market in town for five years. She is going to purchase four bales of clothing. She would like to obtain more loans and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothing

loans.name: Usiano Group

texts.fr: Bavunyake est une femme ambitieuse, conseillère du collectif de crédits Usiano, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent de l’Etat, âgée de 52ans, mère de 9 enfants, dont 7 vont à l’école et 2 sont mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché secondaire de la ville. Elle va s’approvisionner en pommes de terre. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Bavunyake is an ambitious woman and an advisor of the loan collective Usiano. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 52 years old, married to a government representative, and the mother of nine children (seven going to school and two married). She started her business with funds from her husband. Bavunyake sells grocery items at a secondary market in town. She is going to stock up on potatoes. She would like to obtain more loans to grow her business and to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on potatoes

loans.name: Sabagul

texts.ru: Сабагул родилась в 1959 году. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Сабагул начала свой бизнес купле продажей фруктов и овощей 3 года назад. Она торгует на местном рынке и имеет свою лавку. Сабагул продает многие виды фруктов как яблоко, бананы, груша, а также овощи огурцы, перец, помидор и т.п. Сабагул является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее дети имеют маленький доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Ее дом в плохом состоянии. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sabagul was born in 1959. She is a widow and has 4 children. Sabagul started her own business in selling fruits and vegetables 3 years ago. She sells at a local market and has her own retail space. Sabagul sells many types of fruits, such as apples, bananas, pears, and also vegetables, such as cucumbers, peppers, tomatoes, etc. Sabagul is the sole provider for her family because her children have small incomes. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to buy construction materials to repair her house. Her house is in a bad condition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for his graphic design classes.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Мастона 35-летняя швея. Она проживает в районе Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Мастона живет с мужем, двумя детьми и свекровью. У нее 6-летняя дочь и 4-летний сын. Мастона трудолюбивая общительная женщина. Она работает швеей уже 6 лет. Ей нравится обслуживать клиентов. Мастона шьет женские платья разных фасонов, одновременно она обучает девушек и женщин кройки и шитью. 
Мастона обратилась за кредитом для ремонта своего дома. Она хочет улучшить жилищные условия и так как собственных средств не хватает, она надеется на финансовую поддержку. Мастона будет выплачивать кредит за счет своей швейной деятельности.
texts.en: Mastona is a 35-year-old seamstress. She lives in the B. Gafurov district, in the city of Khujand. Mastona lives with her husband, two children and mother-in-law. She has a 6-year-old daughter and a 4-year-old son. Mastona is hardworking and communicable woman. She has been working as a seamstress for 6 years. She likes dealing with customers. Mastona sews various styles of women's dresses and concurrently teaches other women how to cut and sew. Mastona requested this loan to repair her house. She wants to improve her living conditions and, because she does not have her own means, hopes for the financial support. Mastona will repay the loan with the earnings from her sewing business.

loans.use: to repair her house in order to improve living conditions

loans.name: Mwamba Group

texts.fr: Mastaki est commerçante et trésorière de la banque communautaire Mwamba, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un enseignant, âgée de 44 ans, mère de 10 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’un crédit familial. Elle est sociétaire d’une boutique de divers articles manufacturés depuis 22 ans. Elle va acheter les savons, bougies, sardines, biscuits, stylos, cahiers etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mastaki is a merchant and the treasurer of the community bank Mwamba. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 44 years old, married to a teacher, and the mother of ten children, all provided with education. She started her business with family loan funds. Mastaki has been an associate of a store selling shop goods for 22 years. She is going to purchase soaps, candles, sardines, cookies, ballpoint pens, notebooks, etc. She would like to obtain more loans to increase her sales and to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, candles, sardines, cookies, ballpoint pens, notebooks, etc.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito porque le permiten mejorar las condiciones económicas y el estilo de vida familiar, comprara hilos, telas, agujas, tijeras, botones, etc., y otros materiales para elaborar prendas de vestir como faldas, pantalones, vestidos, etc.,
El efecto que experimento con el crédito anterior ha sido positivo, tuvo recursos económicos para comprar la materia prima para mantener la sastrería funcionando, la demanda de sus servicios ha crecido, los ingresos son mejores, vive con su familia en mejores circunstancias y pudo comprarse una nueva máquina de coser valorada en $450.00, con la que ha mejorado su equipo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to take out a new loan in order to improve her economic situation and her family's life. She will buy thread, fabric, needles, scissors, buttons and other materials in order to make clothing such as skirts, pants, dresses, etc.

Her experience with the previous loan was very positive, as it allowed her to buy materials to keep her dressmaking business going. The demand for her services increased and her income improved, as did her family's circumstances. She was also able to buy a new sewing machine worth $450 that has improved her working conditions.

loans.use: buy thread, fabric, needles, scissors, buttons and other materials in order to make clothing such as skirts, pants, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: Mugala est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire Asifiwe, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un taximan de moto, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 8 enfants, dont 5 scolarisés et 3 sont encore gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de souliers plastics dans un marché de la ville  depuis 3 ans. Elle va acheter 150 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs excluent du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Mugala is a merchant and a member of the community bank Asifiwe. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 38 years old, married to a motorbike taxi driver, and the mother of eight children (5 in school and 3 still very young). She started her business with funds from her husband. Mugala has been a vendor of plastic footwear at a town market for three years. She is going to purchase 150 pairs of shoes. She would like to obtain more loans and to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 150 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru: Шамсия трудолюбивая женщина. Она жизнерадостная и добрая женщина. Шамсия родилась в 1994 году. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Шамсия 10 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания, так как она очень нуждалась в источнике дохода. Ее муж мастер по ремонту дома и имеет не большую зарплату. Шамсия продает продукты питания на лавке. Она имеет большой опыт, так как уже более 10 лет она занимается этим бизнесом. Шамсия хочет пополнить оборотный капитал и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shamsiya is a hardworking woman. She is a cheerful and kind woman. Shamsiya was born in 1994. She is married, but does not have children. Ten years ago, Shamsiya started her own business buying and selling food products, since she very much needed a source of income. Her husband is a handyman for home repairs and has a small salary. Shamsiya sells groceries from a bench. She has a lot of experience, since she has already been engaged in this work for more than ten years. Shamsiya wants to replenish her working capital and therefore she is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni with this aim.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has operated a clothing sales business for 7 years.  She is 39 years old,married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 6 children.  Her spouse also provides additional income to support their family. 

She will be using this loan to buy more clothing stock such as sweaters, dresses, blouses, and skirts to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the basic needs of her family, such as food.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to educate her children, as well as open a shop to sell clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been selling dried fish for almost fourteen years, and she earns well from this business. She sustains all her needs through her business, while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To further improve sales, Valeriana would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fish to sell. With PHP 40,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of dried fish which are needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know of her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Valeriana hopes to have her own stall within the public market so that she can give her children quality education. She also dreams of having their own house. She is an active community partner of CCT. She meets with her fellowship* group every Thursday.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Tuamuke Group

texts.fr: Véronique est une femme ambitieuse et trésorière du collectif de crédits Tuamuke, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chômeur, âgée de 52 ans et mère de 7 enfants  tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires sur la route secondaire de la ville. Elle va s’approvisionner en farine de maïs. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Véronique is an ambitious woman and the treasurer of the loan collective Tuamuke. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 52 years old, married to an unemployed man, and the mother of seven children (all in school). She started her business with funds from her husband. Véronique has been a vendor of grocery items on the secondary road in town. She is going to stock up on cornmeal. She would like to obtain more loans and to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on cornmeal

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel works hard to support her family. Raquel is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. In the picture, Raquel is carrying one of her children.

Raquel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

Raquel has been in this business for two years now.

Raquel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Annabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from grinding rice. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers through her fish-vending business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with two children, and is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Melanie is 30 years old, and has two children who attend school.  One of her two children is pictured with Melanie in the picture.

For 3 years, Melanie has operated food vending business in the Philippines, and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Melanie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Al- Asdika Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Asdika. It consists of four women from the city of Mokala, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Afrah is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is four years old and the youngest one is one year old. Afrah lives with her family in a humble area in Mokala. She studied up to the elementary level of education. Due to the fact that she got married when she was very young, she couldn't complete her study. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Afrah wants to help him improve the condition of the family. The house where she lives with her family lacks of many home appliances, and she can't afford this. Mokala has a hot climate year-round, particularly in the summer season. Unfortunately, the air conditioner of the house became very old. They need to a new one. For this reason, Afrah is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new air conditioner for the house.

Afrah looks forward to purchasing all necessary home appliances to make a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new air-conditioner for the house.

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.ru: Норбиби 56 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет  7 детей. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина и имеет более чем 10 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается куплей продажей продукты питания в продовольственном магазине. В последнее время у нее мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и она не может придерживать своих клиентов, которые делают покупки из новых супермаркетов.  Она должна срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы вернуть своих клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для того, чтобы купить хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки и молочные продукты. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Norbibi is 56 years old. She is married and has seven children. She is a very hardworking woman and has more than ten years experience in business. She buys and sells food products in a grocery store. In recent times she has had few customers since competition is heavy, and she cannot retain her customers who are making purchases at new supermarkets. She must urgently expand her inventory in order to get her customers back. She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni for this in order to buy bread, butter, sausage products, jams, drinks, and dairy products.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Navruza

texts.ru: Навруза добросовестная девушка. Она успешно окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Технический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Она поступила в экономический факультет. Навруза не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Ее мать работает медсестрой в поликлинике. Она должна оплатить за учебу, но она не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Navruza is a conscientious young woman. She successfully completed a secondary school and was accepted to the Technical Institute of the Tajikistan Technological University. She was accepted to the economics department. Navruza is not married and lives with her parents. Her father is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Her mother works as a nurse at a hospital. She has to pay for her tuition, but does not have money. Navruza is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 US dollars to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru: Розия живет в районе Хуросон с двумя дочерьми. В течение 10 лет она занимается шитьем, а также животноводством. Ей 52 года. Розия выращивает крупнорогатых скотин и сейчас в ее хозяйстве имеется два быка. Оба дочерей помогают ей в деятельностях, так как у них нет других источников дохода. Одна дочь Розии является студенткой. Она в этом году поступила в Таджикский Национальный Университет в факультет "Химии" и будет учиться там в очном отделении на договорной основе. В связи с этим Розия обратилась за кредитом, чтобы оплатить годовой контракт дочери. Она верит, что из ее дочери выйдет хороший специалист. Поэтому Розия просит Вас помочь ей.
texts.en: Roziya lives in the Khuroson region with two daughters. Over the course of ten years, she has been engaged in sewing as well as raising livestock. She is 52 years old. Roziya raises cattle and now on her homestead she has two bulls. Both daughters help her in the activities, since they do not have other sources of income. One of Roziya's daughters is a college student. This year she enrolled in the Tajik National University in the Chemistry department and will study there on a full-time tuition basis. In connection with this, Roziya applied for a loan in order to pay her daughter's tuition. She believes that her daughter will become a good specialist. Therefore, Roziya is requesting help.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition at the university

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура в возрасте 37 лет имеет мужа и троих детей, с которыми она живет в северном городе Худжанд. Ее детям 18, 10 и 8 лет, все они учатся. Муж Манзуры работает охранником в ресторане. Сама Манзура в течение 2 лет занимается выпечкой пирожков с начинкой. Таким образом она помогает мужу обеспечивать семью. 
Старшая дочь Манзуры является студенткой первого курса. Она учится в Политехническом Институте на программиста-экономиста. Она умная целеустремленная девушка. Мама видит способности дочери и очень рада за нее. Сейчас Манзура за счет кредит хочет оплатить годовой контракт дочери. Для этой цели она просит 1000 долларов США. Манзура надеется, что ей окажут финансовую поддержку и заранее благодарит за помощь.
texts.en:
Manzura is 37 years old, has a husband and three children, with whom she lives in the northern city of Khujand. Her children are 18, 10 and 8 years old, and they all are studying. Manzura's husband works as a guard at a restaurant. Manzura herself over the course of two years has been baking filled pies. In this way, she helps her husband to support the family.

Manzura's elder daughter is a first year university student. She is studying at the Political Institute in an economist program. She is a clever, purposeful, young woman. Mama sees her daughter's capabilities and is very glad for her. Now, Manzura thanks to the loan wants to pay her daugher's annual tuition. With this goal, she is requesting US$1,000. Manzura hopes that she will have financial support and sends her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition at the university

loans.name: Mustafo

texts.ru: Мустафо 54 года. Он зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. Этой деятельностью он занимается на протяжении 20 лет. Мустафо многодетный отец. У него шестеро детей, из которых четверо мальчики и двое девочки. Двое его сыновей работают в России. Третий сын студент. Он учится в Кургантюбинском Государственном Университете в факультете "Иностранных языков". Он поступил в университет в этом году и занятия уже начались, однако за годовое обучение в ВУЗе его родители еще не оплатили. Мустафо не имеет таких больших денег, поэтому он решил обратиться за кредитом. Из 2000 долларов суммы кредита, 70% пойдут на оплату контракта, а остальные 30% на покупку учебных принадлежностей. Их семья надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en: Mustafo is a 54 years old. He earns a living by providing a taxi service. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. Mustafo has a large family. He has six children - four boys and two girls. Two of his sons work in Russia. The third son is a student. He attends the Qurgan-Tube State University, majoring in foreign languages. He was accepted to the university this year, the studies have started, but the parents have not yet paid for his university tuition. Mustafo does not have money like this, and this is why he requested a loan. 70% of the 2000 US dollar loan will go toward paying for the tuition, and the remaining 30% for buying school supplies. Their family relies on this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition and buy school supplies

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris was born in 1990. He is a kind and smart man. 

Idris is a student of the fourth course. He studies in the faculty of management at Tajikistan Technology University. He studies well and he is one of the best students. Idris is not married. He lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. Idris studied last year. After graduating, he wants to work in a bank. 

Idris is asking for a loan of USD 900 to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Ra'no

texts.ru: 45-летняя Раъно является уроженкой предгорного района Вахш, где сам климат благоприятствует здесь ведению сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Раъно как и многие ее односельчане занимается растениеводством и животноводством. В этих деятельностях она имеет 10-летний опыт. Ей усердно помогают дочери. У нее их четверо. Ее дочки учатся в школе, а после занятий помогают матери в ее сельском хозяйстве. Сейчас Раъно до наступления холодов хочет построить хороший коровник для своих скотов. Однако для этой цели ее собственных средств не хватает, в связи с этим Раъно обратилась за кредитом. Без вашей поддержки ей не осуществить свою цель.
texts.en: 45-year-old Ra'no is a native of the suburban Vakhsh district, where she successfully runs an agricultural business. Ra'no, like many of her village neighbors, is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry. She has 10 years of experience in this business. Her daughters, and she has four, diligently help her. Her daughters attend a school and help their mother with the agricultural business after school. Now Ra'no wants to build a good cowshed for her livestock before the onset of cold weather; however, she does not have enough of her own money to achieve this goal. This is why Ra'no requested this loan. She cannot achieve her goal without your support.

loans.use: to build a new cowshed for her livestock before the onset of cold weather

loans.name: Chehron

texts.ru: Чехрон проживает в районе Вахш с матерью и двумя сестрами. Ему 22 года, он учится в городе Душанбе. Чехрон берет повторный кредит для оплаты за второй год обучения в ВУЗ-е. Он учится во втором курсе Таджикского Национального Университета. Чехрон с детства мечтал работать в Правительстве государства и поэтому стремится получить хорошее высшее образование. Он очень целеустремленный молодой человек. Сейчас Чехрон обратилася за кредитом для оплаты за свой годовой контракт. Так как его мать работает в магазине продавщицей, погашение кредита будет идти за счет ее деятельности. Их семья надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en:
Chehron resides in the Vakhsh region with his mother and two sisters. He is 22 years old and he studies in the city of Dushanbe. Chehron is taking a repeat loan to pay for his second year's tuition at the Tajik National University. Since childhood, Chehron has dreamed of working in the state government and therefore he is striving to get a good higher education. He is a very driven, young man.

Now, Chehron applied for a loan to pay his tuition. Since his mother works as a sales clerk in a store, the loan payments will come through her activities. Their family needs this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 45 years old, and married with a daughter and two sons. Her husband is a laborer and earns money for the family somehow. The family lives in IDP settlement and the main source of income is gardening. Kamala has been raising seasonal fruits and selling them at local bazaar for 22 years. Her monthly income is 180AZN, and this money doesn’t cover the family needs. 

Kamala sells fruit at the local bazaar because she knows that fresh fruit is always in high demand. She raises very tasty fruit such as grapes, apples, cherries, etc.

Kamal’s income isn’t enough for the family, and she applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy good garden tools and fertilizer. This purchase will increase productivity and the income of the family. This is her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy good garden tools and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mkuza Group

texts.en:
Anisia, who is in her mid 30s, is married with five children: three boys and two girls.  All of them are still at school.  She has been running a business of planting and selling vegetables, and she also sells fruits and other types of vegetables which she does not have in her garden.  She works from 07 am to 6.30 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Anisia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy manure, seeds, and insecticide for her vegetable garden. She dreams of making her business big.

Anisia will share this loan with her loan group, "MKUZA", which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and insecticide for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: 04 Thắng Lộc, Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Cậy works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. Cậy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Cậy is the group leader of the 04 Thắng lộc, ngư lộc solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. In 2013, Cậy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Cậy has successfully repaid 2 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Cậy is 50 years old and she is married with 3 children. With her business profit, Cậy hopes that her business will do well, that she will be able to build a new house, and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Thơ

texts.en:
Mrs. Thơ operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Thơ is 60 years old and she is married with four children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thơ  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her  business. Thơ  has successfully repaid one loan from FPW. 

Thơ  has been involved in her business for eight years. The main hardship that Thơ  faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thơ  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Petronia

texts.en:
Petronia is 32 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Petronia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Petronia has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Petronia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 26 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Sally is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Sally requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
