Sally has been pig-fattening for one year now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Sally would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Las Quebradas 2 Group

texts.es:
Don Emilio, tiene 65 años de edad, esta casado, es padre de 10 hijos, vive con su esposa y 3 de sus hijos y un nieto en una aldea de Yamaranguila, Intibucá. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos. El cultiva papas en forma grupal y en forma individual cultiva hortalizas como remolacha, coliflor y brócoli. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Don Emilio ha solicitado otro préstamo por 16,000 Lempiras en forma individual, con el cual va comprar fungicidas e insecticidas para darle asistencia técnica a los cultivos con el fin de mejorar la producción y los ingresos. Su meta es mejorar su condición de vida y continuar con la producción.
El grupo se llama Las Quebradas 2 y esta integrado por 7 miembros, de los cuales 6 han decidido solicitar otro préstamo de 16,000 Lempiras cada uno haciendo un total grupal por 96,000 Lempiras para comprar fungicidas e insecticidas y mejorar el cultivo de papas, todos viven en la misma comunidad. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Pio, sigue Calixto, Bernardo, Emilio, Luis y Tomas a la derecha.
texts.en:
Emilio is 65 years old, married and the father of 10 children. He lives with his wife, 3 of their children, and a grandson in a small town in Yamaranguila, Intibucá. 

His whole life he has made his living farming staple foods. He grows potatoes as part of a group, and individually he grows vegetables such as beets, cauliflower and broccoli. He sells the produce in the local market.

Emilio has applied for another individual loan, for 16,000 Lempiras. He'll use the loan to buy fungicide and insecticide to assist the crops to improve the production and the profits. His goal is to improve the quality of his life and keep working in the production.


The group's name is Las Quebradas 2, and it is made up of 7 members, 6 of whom have decided to apply for another loan of 16,000 Lempiras each, for a group total of 96,000 Lempiras to buy fungicides and insecticides, and to improve their potato production. They all live in the same community.

In the photo they are: front left - Pio, followed by Calixto, Bernardo, Emilio, Luis, and Tomas to the right.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and insecticides to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Sundeline

texts.en:
Sundeline is 51 years old and married.  

Sundeline is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and root crops in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Sundeline has been farming vegetables and root crops for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sundeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is married and works hard to support her family by running a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this line of work for one year and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Som Group

texts.en: Chomesee's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottles water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.   Chomesee is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ruqiyya

texts.en:
Ruqiyya is 24 years old, and married with two sons. The family lives in an IDP settlement because they are refugees. The main source of income is gardening; Ruqiyya raises and sells fruits and vegetables. She has worked in this field for four years, and her monthly income is 200 AZN.

Raising and selling fruits and vegetables is much expanded in Azerbaijan. People buy fresh fruits to prepare different delicious pies and juices and use vegetables to cook tasty dishes. 

Ruqiyya loves her family very much, and tries to earn money to cover the needs. She applied for an 1500 AZN loan in order to buy fertilizer for the garden and increase the productivity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the garden

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Đông Cương Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thủy earns a living raising poultry and is requesting a loan to buy more baby poultry to raise and sell. She is 42 years old and married with three children, and also leads a loan group called the Nhóm 03 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of five members. Mrs. Thuy lives in Thanh Hoa province. She has been in her current line of work for six years, and this is her first loan request. The main obstacle she faces in her business is a lack of capital. She plans to use her profits to keep her family healthy and happy, her business succeeding, and her children doing well in school.

loans.use: to buy more baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Ninh Phú Group

texts.en:
Minh has a stall selling vegetable. She is applying for a loan to purchase more vegetable to resell.

Minh is 63 years old and she is married with no children. 
She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Ninh Phú Group solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 
In 2013, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Minh has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable to resell

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
This is Angelito. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for his personal, household and business expenditures.

He would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover his daily needs and additional expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Angelito hopes to have a better life; that is why he is saving for his future. He meets weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work  and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 35 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana, se mantiene trabajando para ir progresando, opta por un nuevo crédito para realizar la compra de pan, embutidos, aderezos, granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, etc., así podrá elaborar la venta de comida rápida y surtir su negocio. Espera seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes y ampliando su negocio.
Al saber administrar el préstamo anterior Ana actualmente tiene un negocio más rentable, con nuevos productos y ya vende hamburguesas, para tener mejores ingresos, su situación económica es más estable permitiéndole cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Ana continues working so she can to keep progressing. She is opting for a new loan in order to buy bread, cold meat, seasoning, dry grains, drinks, candy etc so she can sell fast food and stock her store. She hopes to expand her business and keep her customers satisfied.

Because she knew how to manage her previous loan well, Ana's business is now more profitable. She stocks new products and is already selling hamburgers so she can earn a better income. Her economic situation is now more stable, allowing her to cover her family's basic necessities and make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bread, cold meat, seasoning, dry grains, drinks, candy, etc so she can sell fast food and stock her store.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora  Gregoria   de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de tortillas.
Doña Gregoria sus clientes le visitan en su casa y junto con la ayuda de sus dos hijas elabora   tortillas todo los días de lunes a domingo, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene más de cuatro ciclos de trabajar con Prisma y ha demostrado buen  comportamiento de pago en sus préstamos.
Doña Gregoria está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal.  Con el apoyo de este crédito la señora desea comprar por mayor la materia prima para realizar su negocio, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Uno de sus sueños es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Gregoria is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children. She has her own house. For five years, she has had a business selling tortillas from her house, to which her customers come. With the help of her two daughters, Gregoria works every day from Monday to Sunday making tortillas. She is a hard-working woman who has had over four loan cycles with the Field Partner, Prisma, and has demonstrated good performance in paying back her loans. Gregoria is applying for this loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime. With the support of this loan, she wants to buy the basic materials for her business wholesale. She is very happy to continue to work with Prisma. One of her dreams is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- August 2014

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood and lime for her business

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en: Mrs. Trần works in agriculture raising poultry, and is requesting a loan to buy more baby poultry to raise and sell. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of one child. Trần leads the Nhóm 01 thôn 9 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives in the Quang Xuong district, a  rural area of Thanh Hoa province. This is her first loan request from the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Tần has been involved in her current line of work for more than ten years, and the main challenge she faces is a lack of capital. With her business profit, Trần hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her child to succeed in school.

loans.use: to buy more baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rhodia

texts.en:
Rhodia is 29 years old and comes from Carles, Iloilo. She is married with a son who is two years old. For four years now, she has been engaged in fishing for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy rope, fishing weights and floaters. 

Rhodia is confident that with the right equipment comes increased productivity in fishing. It is worth investing. She hopes that with the loan she can make up for the times when fishing did not give much after typhoon Haiyan that devastated their place.  The income generated from fishing will be used to buy healthy food for her family and savings for her son's future education.

loans.use: to buy rope, fishing weights and floaters

loans.name: God Fearing Group

texts.en:
Moreblessing is a 39 year old entrepreneur who a member and secretary of the God Fearing group. She is married and blessed with 2 children of school going age. The husband left for South Africa to look for greener pastures so she is left to fend for the family on her own. 

Moreblessing is a tailor by trade, when she came to Thrive she used to sell the uniforms she sews in the streets in town. After getting the first loan she managed to secure a place in town where she sews and sells her uniforms. Her business has been growing and she has been able to take her children to school without any challenges. 

Through the God fearing savings club she was able to buy a new bed and pots for herself. In this second loan cycle a portion of $900 will assist her in restocking fabric to sew a variety of summer uniforms whose demand will increase since schools are opening in September.  Moreblessing appreciates the training she received from Thrive and her other group members for their support and reliability which enabled them to repay the first loan without any challenges.

loans.use: To restock fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Tsungayi Group

texts.en:
Sekina is a member of Tsungayi Group. The group is based in Glenview 1, Harare. Sekina and her group members are now in their 3rd loan cycle with Thrive Microfinance. With her 1st Loan cycle, Sekina who was a cross border trader, added more products to her business. Her cross border business gave her money to start a goat business, going to buy goats in rural areas and reselling them in butcheries. With her 2nd Loan Sekina left the goat business and started buying cattle for resale in butcheries which has better returns. 

Sekina is a widowed mother of two children, one school going. She is the breadwinner and the growth of her business has helped her to be able to support her children. With the 3rd loan that she has been given Sekina plans to grow her cattle business as she is planning on having a constant supply of cattle to her clients (butcheries).The growth of her business will mean that she can have higher returns and be able to buy a residential stand for herself.

loans.use: To expand her cattle trading business

loans.name: Women Of Destiny Group

texts.en:
Atumire is a member of the Women of Destiny group, based in Dzivarasekwa, Harare. The group consists of four hardworking and progressive minded members who came together when they felt the need to encourage each other in their businesses so as to attain business growth. They continually attend trainings offered at Thrive. These trainings have helped the group in managing their credit sales as well as forecasting in their businesses.

Atumire started buying and selling chicken cutlets and fish 10 years ago. Her wish was to increase the products she sells as people could come asking for products she could not stock. Her main challenge in achieving her wish was lack of capital and high restocking costs. After making one loan with Thrive, she managed to restock ice creams. With the Kiva loan, Atumire will increase refreshment in her range.

loans.use: To increase the range of products she sells, including refreshments

loans.name: Mwari Anesu Group

texts.en:
Julita is a member of Mwari Anesu (God is with us) group, staying in Dzivarasekwa Suburb in Harare South. She is in the poultry business and has been doing this business since 2009, although she used to do batches inconsistently. She got her first loan from Thrive Microfinance in July 2013. From then she started having constant batches of chickens of 100 at a time and that was good for her business as she earned goodwill from her clients and managed to establish a good client base. 

Julita and her group members applied for and were given a second loan in January 2014 and with this loan she increased her batch to 200 chickens at a time. Her business has grown from a 100 chicken per batch to 200 and now to 300 birds. Julia also constructed another fowl run to accommodate her larger batches. Julita also introduced another business line, that of buying and selling maize. With this loan Julita wants to continue to grow her chicken business and source large quantities of maize grain for resale.  Her livelihood has improved significantly and she is now also complementing the family income and is able to now send her children to boarding schools. She is now also able to support her other extended family members. Julita feels uplifted by the loans that she has gotten from Thrive Microfinance.

loans.use: To expand her poultry and maize business.

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.ru: Эту предприимчивую и целеустремленную женщину зовут Бибирачаб. Она в возрасте 52 лет начинает новый бизнес. Бибирачаб в данный момент занимается шитьем мужских национальных одеяний и теперь параллельно хочет заняться еще и животноводством. У нее при дворе дома имеется старый сарай для содержания скотов и она уже запаслась кормом для скотов. На сумму кредита Бибирачаб хочет приобрести крупнорогатый скот. Она надеется на поддержку, так как хочет принести в семью дополнительный источник дохода и улучшить финансовое положение.
texts.en: The name of this entrepreneurial and goal-oriented woman is Bibirajab. She is 62 years old and starting a new business. Bibirajab is currently involved in sewing men's national clothing and now wants to concurrently get involved in animal husbandry. She has an old barn in her backyard, where she can keep livestock, and she has already stocked up on livestock feed. Bibirajab wants to use the loan amount to buy cattle. She hopes for the support because she wants to bring in an additional source of income for the family and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start a new animal husbandry business

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Vạn Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga works in agriculture, raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Nga is 46 years old and she is married, with four children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 01 Vạn Thắng solidarity group. 

In 2013, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nga has been involved in her business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nga hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 25-year-old married refugee. She has a daughter and the family lives in an IDP settlement. She raises and sells seasonal fruits at the local bazaar. She has been working in this field for four years and her monthly income is 220 AZN.

Gulshan has a small grocery at the local bazaar and sells her harvest during the day. Local people know her very well and are always satisfied by the harvest they buy. They know that these fruits are always fresh and tasty.

Gulshan’s income from selling fruit doesn’t cover her family’s needs. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy good fertilizer and raise more fruit. She needs to help her family and provide her lovely daughter a happy childhood.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizer and raise more fruit.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Сафаргуль является животноводом, проживающим в районе Вахш. Ей 53 года. Она хорошая жена и заботливая мать. Сафаргуль живет в селе района вместе с мужем, тремя сыновьями, свекровью и сестрой. Ее сыновьям больше 18 лет. Ее муж работает преподавателем в автошколе. Сафаргуль занимается растениеводством, и одновременно ведет свой животноводческий бизнес. Она на приусадебном участке земли, который составляет 0,15 га сеет болгарский перец,помидор и кукурузу.
Параллельно с растениеводством на протяжение 10 лет Сафаргуль выращивает крупнорогатый и мелкорогатй скот. Сейчас в ее хозяйстве имеется всего один бычок и три овец. Сафаргуль с целью расширения поголовья своего крупнорогатого скота запрашивает кредит. На сумму кредита она планирует купить двух маленьких бычков для дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Сафаргуль надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Safargul raises livestock in the Vakhsh region. She is 53, a good wife and a loving mother. Safargul lives in a village with her husband, three children, her mother-in-law, and her sister. Her sons are over 18 and her husband is a teacher at a driving school. Safargul plants crops and runs a livestock business at the same time. She has a 0.15 hectare plot of land where she grows bell peppers, tomatoes, and corn. 
In addition to planting crops, Safargul has been raising cattle and small livestock for over ten years. Right now she only has one young bull and three sheep. She is taking out a loan to acquire more livestock. She plans to use the loan to buy two young bulls to fatten and resell. Safargul hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз выходец из района Дж.Руми. Он предприимчивый усердный молодой человек, которому исполнилось уже 25 лет. Фируз холост и живет с родителями и двумя старшими братьями. Он ранее работал на рынке наемным продавцом и приобрел достаточный опыт в сфере продаж. Теперь Фируз хочет иметь собственный бизнес и работать на себя. Он приобрел торговую точку на рынке и еще имеет сбережение в размере 250 долларов США. Так как этой суммы недостаточно для купли товара, он обратился за кредитом. Фируз планирует продавать детскую одежду, он надеется, что его поддержат и он успешно начнет собственный торговый бизнес.
texts.en: Firuz is a native of the J. Rumy district. He is an entrepreneurial and diligent young man, who has already turned 25 years old. Firuz is single and lives with his parents and older brothers. He had previously worked as a hired salesperson at a market and obtained sufficient experience in the retail field. Now Firuz wants to have his own business and work for himself. He purchased a retail outlet at a market and has savings of 250 US dollars. Because this sum is not enough to buy merchandise, he requested a loan. Firuz plans to sell children's clothing and hopes that he will be supported, and will successfully start his own retail business.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing in order to start his own retail business

loans.name: Nodirjon

texts.ru: Нодирчону 19 лет. Он холост и живет с матерью. Его мать больна. Он энергичный и активный студент 1 курса Медицинского Университета Таджикистана. Он мечтает стать хорошим специалистом будущим. У него много друзей и они все любят и уважают Нодирчона. Данное время он нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как он должен оплатить за учебный договор. Нодирчон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nodirjon is 19 years old. He is single and lives with his mother, who is ill. He is an energetic and active first-year student of the Tajikistan Medical University. He dreams of becoming a good specialist in the future. He has many friends, all of whom love and respect Nodirjon. At the present time, he needs financial support because he has to pay for his university contract. Nodirjon is requesting a loan to pay for his studies at the university. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and her three children who attend school. She has been working in the agricultural field for the past two years, as she wanted to help her husband in paying for their substantial living expenses. With the loan she requested from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase pesticides and seeds to grow more products in order to be able to earn a higher income. Najah is fairly certain that this loan will improve her business as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Lan works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Lan is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives with three dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Lan is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 thôn 9 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members. This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 51-year-old mother who was blessed with four children. Her family currently lives in a rural community and earns a living through farming. Due to financial insufficiency, Susan engages in the hog-raising business to help her husband in earning income. She aims to strengthen this business and generate sufficient income, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

location.town: Brgy. Carolotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a single, 23-year-old Lebanese woman living with her family. She is the only family member who works in cooperation with her father to provide the family with satisfactory revenue to meet their demands. Mona has been the owner of a clothing store since 2010; she offers fashionable and stylish designs to her clientele. With the loan she requested from Kiva field partner Vitas s.a.l., she plans to purchase the new winter collection, since this season is about to begin and she must get ready to welcome customers asking for cold-weather clothes. Mona is a very positive person and she believes that this Kiva loan will definitely enhance her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase the new winter collection

loans.name: Sri Manikkanatchiyamman Shg - Ayyanallur Group

texts.en:
Sri Manikkanatchiyamman Shg - Ayyanallur Group consists of eighteen members; Devi is the leader of the group.
    
Devi has two children and lives in her own house in Ayyanallur village, Tanjore district. Her husband is a small marginal farmer working for daily wages.             

A large number of people, especially in rural places in India, still use wood as the main source of heat for cooking, many of them using open fires. Open fires are not only inefficient but they produce smoke, which is harmful to health, and present a risk to children of burning. The inefficiency of open fires results in large amounts of wood being burned, contributing to deforestation, and hard work for the women and children collecting it. 

For the above reasons, women from this group are requesting a loan to buy smokeless stoves, which will help them to save money, time and keep their families healthier as well.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Omsakthi Shg - Umamaheshwarapuram Group

texts.en:
Malathy (the featured borrower, who is standing with her hand raised) and six of her friends, Sudha, Sathyaprabha, Pattu, Selvi, Mangaiyarkarasi, and Uma, have formed a group called "Omsakthi." All hail from Umamaheshwarapuram village of Tanjore in Tamil Nadu. 

Most of them are daily-wage labourers to help supplement their household income. These diligent women are unable to save money from their monthly income. A major chunk of their income goes towards buying firewood or kerosene, and a lot of their time is spent cooking over traditional chulha stoves. These chulhas, apart from being time-consuming, also emit a lot of smoke, which plays havoc with their health. This adds to their medical expenses.
 
To tackle these problems, they have approached PAT (MicroGraam’s field partner) to buy Greenway cook stoves. The benefits of a Greenway cook stove are that it leads to fuel savings, minimizes emissions of CO and CO2, supports fast and convenient cooking, is highly durable, and is maintenance-free and smokeless. The stove operates on solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung, and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost. 

They are seeking a group loan repayable in easy installments. Malathy, like the other borrowers, intends to use the loan to purchase a Greenway cook stove. Your loan will help these women to have better health and also help them save a little money.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Tun's Group

texts.en:
Tun is 61 years old and widowed with five children. She lives in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district, in the province of Battambang. She earns a living through growing cassava, which they have been doing for three years. The current business earns them about 20,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 4,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Tun’s group consists of two female members who have been members of VisionFund for one cycle. Tun successfully used her first loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labour. She hopes to grow her cassava successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 20-year-old single young man from Deir El Balah. He lives with his family in a small house. His mother has a store for selling kids clothes where she gets a good income, but it is not stable. This is the only source of income for the family. Imad is a student where he studies electronic engineering. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future.

Imad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Imad will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily.  

Imad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Định is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members. Định raises poultry, which she has been doing for 10 years. Her main challenge is the lack of capital.

Định is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women, which she will use to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 49, is a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to James and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalinda offers manicures and pedicures. She already has regular customers in her community and they just contact her when they need her. She also provides home service. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosalinda is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy nail polish, a cuticle remover, a pusher, a nail cutter and other materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Rosalinda hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase nail polish, a pusher, a nail cutter and other materials which are needed to improve her manicure and pedicure service.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Antonietta successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Antonietta's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.


*All children appear in the photo has already sign the photo waiver.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 38-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Najma has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years. She also contributes her income to her husband to manage the household.
 
Najma needs to buy different types of cosmetics (e.g., creams, hair brushes, and other accessories) for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Najma has applied for a Kiva loan. 

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose, so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.


With this financial assistance, Najma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 38 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 2 daughters and 1 son. 

Her husband is a driver by profession. And now he wants to buy a new rickshaw but he is not in a position to buy a rickshaw. Due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of purchasing a rickshaw. Therefore Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of buying a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, metal sheeting and beams to build a chicken pen and a toilet in his house.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Hiền has a service business repairing motorcycles and bicycles. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to do motorcycle and bicycle repairing.

Hiền is 48 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hiền is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of five members. This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to do motorcycle and bicycle repairing

loans.name: Dúo Alioto Group

texts.es:
DUO ALIOTO
una de las integrantes de este grupo es Rosaura de 40 años de edad tiene  tres hijos, empezó su negocio vendiendo almuerzos serca de una maquila hace 12 años invirtiendo Q.300.00. Actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de cosmeticos, como cremas shampoo lociones etc y venta de golosinas con el cual desea obtener  mejores ganancias.   Agradece a Dios y a sus padres  por el apoyo  que le han brindado,  su mayor anhelo es sacar adelante a sus hijos. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas productos en cosmeticos y productos comestibles para la venta.Doña Rosaura es la que aparese con blusa planca con lineas celestes y delantal, y la otra persona es la siguiente integrante del dúo
texts.en: 40 year old Rosaura (on the left, wearing an apron) has three children. She started her business selling lunches in an assembly plant 12 years ago investing 300 Guatemalan Quetzales.  Currently she has a business selling beauty products and selling candies and has the desire to increase her earnings. She thanks God and her parents for the support they have offered her, her greatest desire is to get her children ahead. She is requesting this credit to buy more cosmetic products and grocery products to sell. Rosaura's business partner, Nidia, is standing on the right in the picture.

loans.use: Comprar cosmeticos y productos comestibles para la venta.

loans.name: Mamatqurbon

texts.ru:
Этого опытного предпринимателя из района Кубадиён зовут Маматкурбон. Ему 58 лет. Он женат и у него двое сыновей. Маматкурбон имеет семейный торговый бизнес. На центральном рынке района у него имеется два продуктовых магазина. На одном магазине он работает сам, а на втором его жена и невестка. Этот бизнес они продвигают на протяжении 9 лет. Семья Маматкурбона также занимается птицеводством, они выращивают у себя при дворе куропаток.
Сейчас Маматкурбон для расширения бизнеса хочет провести ремонт в одном своем магазине и купить холодильник для хранения тортов. Для этой цели ему не хватает 4000 долларов США и эту сумму он запрашивает в кредит. Маматкурбон надеется на вашу финансовую поддержку. Этот кредит ему очень важен для развития своего малого бизнеса.
texts.en:
This is Mamatqurbon. He is an experienced entrepreneur from the Qubadiyon District. He is 58 years old. He is married and has two sons. Mamatqurbon has a family retail business. He has two grocery shops in the central market of his District. He works in one of the stores, and his wife and daughter-in-law work in the other. They have been running these businesses for 9 years. Mamatqurbon's family also practice poultry farming. They raise partridges in the yard outside their house.

In order to expand his business, Mamatqurbon wants to renovate one of his stores and buy a refrigerator for preserving cakes. For this goal, he needs 4000 USD, which is why he is requesting a loan. Mamatqurbon relies on your financial support. This loan is very critical to the development of his small business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to preserve his cakes, as well as to renovate his store.

loans.name: Johana Group

texts.en: El grupo Johana está conformado por tres socias microempresarias  de éxito una de ella es Johana mujer de 40 años, soltera, desde hace 9 años se dedica a vender comida en su domicilio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles,  pastas, carne de res, carne de cerdo, carne de pollo, salsa de tomate, salsa inglesa, remolacha, zanahoria, lechuga etc. Nubia tiene 60 años su negocio es venta de comida y Roxana tiene 29 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa y perfumen.

loans.use: To buy basic products to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Jose Huberth

texts.es:
Jose Huberth es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad. Vive en casa familiar con madre y hermanos, hace más de 20 años. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jose Huberth se dedica a la venta de cerdos y a la venta de leche fresca. Desde hace más de 03 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para compra de animales y alimentación balanceado de engorde para los animales y así poder venderlos a un mejor precio dado que los animales estaran en un mejor calidad; lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Huberth is single and is 25 years old. He has lived in his family's house with his mother and siblings for more than 20 years. He has good personal and employment references. He lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and raising livestock located in the district of Saña, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru.

Jose Huberth works selling pigs and selling fresh milk. He has been doing this for about 3 years. He will use the loan to buy animals and balanced feed to fatten them. He will be able to sell them at a greater price given that the animals will be of better quality. This will generate more income and in the end improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Vạn Thắng Group

texts.en:
Nga is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She is the leader of the Nhóm 01 Vạn Thắng solidarity group, which consists of our members. Nga raises pigs, which she has been doing for three years. Her main challenge is the illness of the pigs.

Nga is requesting her third loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, she hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Beneda

texts.es:
Beneda tiene 38 años de edad, su estado civil soltera, reside en el caserío potrerillo, vive en casa propia, desde hace más de 15 años junto a sus padres, su comunidad esta habita por personas muy respetuosas y trabajadoras, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de la Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Beneda es a la compra, crianza y venta de animales menores tales como cabritos, ovejas entre otros, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 5 años contando con la experiencia en el negocio. Sus ventas las realiza en su domicilio y alrededores. Beneda cuetna con muy buenas referencias crediticias y en la zona donde vive. el destino del crédito será para la compra de una cantidad mayor de animales y posterior engorde, el dinero restante sera para unificar deudas de edyficar y trabajar exclusivamente con Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Beneda, age 38, is single.  For fifteen years she has lived in her own house with her parents in the Porterillo settlement.  The people in her community are very respectful and hard-working.  This community is located in the Matanza district, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Beneda’s business activity is buying, raising, and selling small animals like goats and sheep, among others.  She has been engaged in this business for over five years, which has given her experience in the business.

She makes her sales at her house and surrounding areas.  Beneda has very good credit references and good references in the area where she lives.

She will use most of the loan to buy a greater number of animals to later fatten.  The other part will be to consolidate debts with Edyficar and to work exclusively with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 - Tiền Phong - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hải operates a small restaurant selling rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook noodles to sell.
Hải is 42 years old, and she is single with three children.
Hải is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 - Tiền Phong - Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.
In 2013, Hải joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hải has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hải has been involved in her business for five years.
The main hardship that Hải faces in her business is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Hải hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook noodles to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Đông Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chính works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.
Chính is 63 years old, and she is married with six children.
She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 04 Đông Thành solidarity group. 
In 2013, Chính joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chính has successfully repaid two loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Chính has been involved in her business for five years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her are illnesses.
With her business profit, Chính hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Tây Sơn 2 - Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga operates a small restaurant selling noodles and rice cakes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook fast food for breakfast to sell.
Nga is 46 years old, and she is married with two children.
Nga is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Tây Sơn 2 - Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of six members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.
In 2012, Nga joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nga has successfully repaid two loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Nga has been involved in this business for two years.
The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook fast food for breakfast to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 13 Tây Sơn 1 - Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Hạnh has a service business tailoring clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth for her tailoring service.

Hạnh is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hạnh is the group leader of the Nhóm 13 Tây Sơn 1 - Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2013, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth for her tailoring service.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in the rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Yorn is 27 years old and married with three children. She earns a living through farming rice and raising cows, and sometimes she works for others for a fee. Her current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day. 
Yorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle, and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Sun is a 36-year-old married mother of three children who are dependent on her; two are in school while another one is too young for school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 30 years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, she also sells porridge in her village. Together, she and her husband can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 
Sun is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Touch is 57 years old and widowed. She has five children. To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming rice for 20 years. The current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day to meet their needs. 
Touch has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five cycles already, and she successfully used the past loans to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is leading her group in asking for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en: Ben lives in a rural area of the Battambang province. She is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and fishing. The current business earns her about 37,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  Ben has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has completely repaid the past loans. Now she is going to lead a group of two to ask for another. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes make more crops from her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Angel Patrocinio

texts.es:
Angel Patrocinio tiene 66 años de edad, reside en el centro de Morropón, vive en casa propia. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y además de el comercio, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Angel Patrocinio principalmente es al alquiler de equipos de sonido, pero también brinda el servicio de transporte en mototaxi, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años, cuenta ya con mucha experiencia en el negocio, él es muy conocido en la zona y, cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una pieza para su sonido(consola); lo que le permitirá equiparlo y complementarlo de la mejor manera para brindar un servicio mejor; de esta forma poder captar más clientes y por consecuente hacer que sus ingresos aumenten, mejoren su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angel Patrocinio, age 66, lives in his own house in the center of Morropón.  Life in the community is peaceful, and the people engage in agriculture and commerce as well as work with livestock.  This community is located in the Morropón district and province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Angel Atrocinio’s main business activity is renting sound systems.  However, he also provides transportation service with a mototaxi.  He has been engaged in this business activity for over ten years.  He now has a lot of experience in the business.  He is very well-known in the area.  He has very good personal as well as work references.

He will use the loan to buy a piece of sound equipment (console).  This will allow him to be equipped and complete his collection in the best way in order to provide better service.  This way he will be able to gain more customers.  This will increase his income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a console (sound equipment).

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: Khorn is age 34 years and married with one son who is still too young for school.  She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district. She and her husband earn a living through planting corn, cabbage and rice, which they have been in for 14 years. Khorn’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village and she is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, Khorn will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Phanna's Group

texts.en: Phanna is 27 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has two dependent children to take care of, and they are now in school in the local area. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for several years. Besides this, she also sells jars and closets to earn additional income for her family. This is the second micro loan for Phanna with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Phanna will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying household supplies. She hopes to earn more income from her new business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and household supplies.

loans.name: Thik's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Thik is a 25-year-old married mother of two children who are too young for school. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for eight years. To better support the family, she works for others for a fee.

Thik has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. The past loans have helped her to better support her family and increase the business. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Thik, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Lun's Group

texts.en: A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Lun is age 50 years and married with two children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living and support her family, Lun and her husband have been farming rice as primary business for 20 years. She can earn about 43,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. This is the first micro loan for Lun’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to request a loan, Lun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru: 45-летняя Оксана живет скромной жизнью в сельском районе Кубадиён. Она занимается там маленьким торговым бизнесом. Оксана сейчас продает мороженное и прохладительные напитки. Параллельно с этим бизнесом она еще  и занимается куплей и продажей миндаля. Муж и дети помогают ей в этом деле. Они оптом закупают у дехкан необработанный миндаль и после его тщательной обработки продают его с наценкой торговцам рынков района и столицы. Этим бизнесом они уже занимаются два года. Целью настоящего кредита является покупка партии необработанного миндаля для последующей обработки и перепродажи. Семья Оксаны надеется на этот кредит, благодаря которому они смогут продолжить торговую деятельность.
texts.en: Forty-five-year-old Oksana lives a modest life in the rural Qubadiyon District. She runs her own small retail business there. Oksana currently sells ice cream and soft drinks. Simultaneously, she buys and sells almonds. Her husband and children help her with this business. They buy raw almonds wholesale from a communal farmer. After thoroughly cleaning and processing them, they sell them at a markup to market vendors in their District and in the capital. They have been running this business for two years already. The purpose of this loan is to buy a shipment of raw almonds to clean, process, and then resell. Oksana's family relies on this loan as, thanks to it, they will be able to continue their sales business.

loans.use: to buy a shipment of raw almonds for resale.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 57 años de edad, su estado civil es Conviviente. Tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz). Vive en el distrito de San Juan de Bigotes, él es natural de la zona, la comunidad es pequeña y los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado menor(patos, pollos, entre otros), comercio de guayaquil y arroz. Dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Julio es el comercio de leña, el compra a un precio por mayor y vende a un precio por menor, adicionamente se dedica también al comercio de ganado menor(patos, pollos, entre otros) y a la siembra y comercialización de arroz. Ingresos adicionales que le permiten cubrir sin problema el crédito el mismo que será usado como capital de trabajo; pues desea invertir en la compra de ganado; para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock, lo que le ayudará a aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por consecuente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio, age 57, is in a common-law marriage.  He has his own house, and he has public services (water and electricity).  He lives in the San Juan de Bigotes district, and he is native to the area.  The community is small, and the inhabitants raise small animals (ducks and chickens, among others), engage in commerce from Guayaquil, and grow rice.  This district is located in the Morropón province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Julio’s business is selling firewood.  He buys it at wholesale price and sells it for retail.  He also sells small animals (ducks and chickens, among others), and he grows and sells rice.  These are additional incomes that allow him to cover the loan without a problem.

The loan will be used as working capital.  He wishes to buy animals in order to be able to increase and diversify his stock.  This will help him to increase his profits, which will improve his earnings and, consequently, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals.

location.town: San Juan de Bigote - Morropon - Piura

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en: Living in a wooden house located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Norm is age 31 years and married. She has one daughter who is still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for six years and they supplement the family’s income by growing sesame in the local area. The current business earns them about 40,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day for the future needs.  Norm has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely repaid the past loans. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao is a 29-year-old mother of five children, four of whom still rely on her; two are too young for schooling and two are in school. Now, her residential area is Battambang province where her rice is grown. Besides this agribusiness, her entire family also counts on fish catching to sell to earn extra income. She has been involved in the current business for several years. For Mao, this is seven cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. Now, her living condition is getting better than before, especially because she can keep her kids in school. For this new loan, she is a group leader.  Mao will spend her entire loan portion to buy a driven-boat machine and cast net to support her fish catching. She hopes this loan can help her to upgrade her business to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a driven-boat machine and cast net.

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en: Pich is a woman who lives in Moung Russey district in Battambang province. She is 44 years old and has three children, and one of them is in school. To strive for a living, she raises pigs and sells snacks as the main source of income; she has been involved in this business for ages. This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans wisely and it has improved her lifestyle gradually.  For this cycle, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more pigs, feed, and to buy ingredients for making snacks to sell. She hopes she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, feed, and to buy ingredients for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Eth's Group

texts.en: Eth, age 43 and a mother of two children, resides in Kampong Cham province. She struggles for a living via rice farming as the main source of income and a paid working job as the supplementary income. The current business earns her about 33,300 KHR per day to secure the needs of her family. She has never been with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner) before, and now she leads a group of six to get a loan. For Eth, the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seeds, and to pay for a hand-tractor leasing fee for plowing her farmland. She hopes that she can replant her cash crop on time, so that she can gain a good yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, and to pay for a hand-tractor leasing fee for plowing her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Khoemhorn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is the name of a farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province. She's 56 years old and she is a mother of two children. Nowadays, she supports her family via cassava farming and vegetable selling. This business earns her about 27,700 KHR per day. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and used it wisely and now her living conditions are getting better than before.  

For this cycle, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings, fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs. She  hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings, fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: A young mother with one schoolchild, Sophea lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 29 years old.  She overcomes her family’s hardships via running a small grocery stall and rice farming. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. Now, she has formed a group of two to get a new loan. She is the group leader and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can replenish her business inventory on time and earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en: As a mother of seven children, Ken is a rice farmer and a fisherwoman. She’s 60 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She tries to run two businesses because she needs to earn more income to support her family and her children. She also earns income about 36,100 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seeds and fishing supplies. Ken hopes this loan can help her family better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fishing supplies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn, a resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 32 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. For the sake of her family, she grows rice as her main business, earning about 36,700 KHR per day. 

As the leader of a group of two, Thorn is requesting her first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farm. She hopes this will result in a better yield than previously.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farm

loans.name: Ing's Group

texts.en: A woman residing in Battambang province, Ing is 51 years old and a mother of four children. She struggles for a living via rice farming as a single source of income. With VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner), Ing is a third-time borrower and she has repaid her past loans completely. Now, her living is getting better. Due to the shortage of working capital, Ing forms a group of three to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that she can keep improving her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Battambang province, Vanny is 22 years old and a mother of one little child. Besides her agricultural business, she secures the needs in her household via her occupation as a teacher in a local school. This is the original loan for Vanny with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has joined a group of two to get a loan and she is the leader. Vanny will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Khean's Group

texts.en: Khean, age 39, is a resident from Prey Veng province. She is a married mother of three children. For her family, rice cropping and selling kramas, a cotton scarf, is how she earns a living. This is the first cycle for Khean with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner) and she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more kramas to sell and fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy more kramas to sell and fertilizer for her crop.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Battambang province. To support the needs of her family, she is a rice farmer and her husband drives a taxi. 

Thy formed a two-person group and they requested a loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She hopes this loan can make her family better than before.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, 35, is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school. To earn a living, she raises pigs and works as a paid employee.

Having repaid her previous loan, Sokha is now requesting her second one from Kiva partner VisionFund. The leader of a group of two, she will use her portion to buy more piglets and pig feed to upgrade her business. 

Sokha hopes this loan can help her earn more income and enjoy greater success in her business.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed to upgrade her business.

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb is living in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. She is 51 years old. She is married and has five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her main business is rice farming and she is also working as a worker. She has been working in these businesses for 10 years. She doesn’t have enough working capital to support her business, so she is now requesting a loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. This is the first loan for her. She will use it to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and pay for labor to plow the field. She hopes that this loan will help her to produce more crops from her farmland so she can support her family’s needs in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds and pay for labor to plow the fields

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy, 23, is a villager from Battambang province. She deals with her daily cost of living via working for others for a fee and catching fish for resale as a  business. She has been involved in her current business for five years, earning about 20,800 KHR per day to support her family. For Thy, this is the second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the leader of the group. She will use her loan portion to buy fish for resale and to buy a casting net to catch more fish. She strongly hopes that she can earn a higher income than before.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale and a casting net to catch more fish.

loans.name: Laing's Group

texts.en: A farmer from Prey Veng province, Laing is 59 years old. She secures the needs of her family via rice cropping, and this business earns her about 35,000 KHR. This is the first loan for Laing with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm. She hopes her family will be better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Banteay Meanchey province, Chantha is 43 years old and has two schoolchildren. To earn a living, she sells vegetables as her single source of income. She has just been running this business for a year so she can get about 29,400 KHR per day in income. 

This is first time for Chantha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In need of working capital, she has formed a group of two to get a loan. She is the group leader, and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more vegetables for resale and to buy a decent motorbike to transport her vegetables to market. She hopes she can make triple income so as to keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to transport her vegetables to market.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en: Thoeurn is a local villager in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is 36 years old and married.  She has two children who depend on her, both of whom are in school.. Her main business is from potato planting. She has been in business for 18 years. In the group of two members, Thoeurn is the group leader. She is leading her group members to apply for a loan and this is the first cycle for her. With her loan portion, she will pay for plowing and labor and use some of it to buy insecticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes that her potatoes will gain more yield so that she can sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and labor and buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng is living in the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is 26 years old and single. To make a livng, she has been selling secondhand clothes and farming rice for six years. She can earn about $24 US per day, but she can save approximately $9 US each day after her daily expenses. This is the second loan cycle for Theng with VisionFund. Now she is seeking a new loan to buy more clothes to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Vong's Group

texts.en: A simple farmer who lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Vong is a mother of seven children. She is 57 years old. Nowadays, she supports her family via rice farming. She can earn an income of about 36,700 KHR per day. Due to the lack of working capital, she forms a group of three to get the first-time loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en: Sarun is age 57 years and married with six children. He lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To make a living, he has been selling coffee for 20 years. With the current business, he can earn about 66,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs, and is able to save about 22,000 KHR each day for the future needs. He is a ninth-cycled client with VisionFund. He completely repaid the past loans. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy more materials for supporting his coffee selling business.  He hopes to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for supporting his coffee selling business.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en: Ley is a woman who lives in Battambang province. She is 47 years old and she is a mother of seven children. She grows cassava as the main source of income to support her family. She has never been with VisionFund,(Kiva’s partner) before, and she  forms a group of two to get the first micro loan. Ley, the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees for her crop. She hopes that she can prepare her land on time, so that she can make a good yield.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees for her crop.

loans.name: Da

texts.en:
Da is 32 years old and has two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in Battambang province. To secure the basic needs of her household, Da grows cassava as the main source of income. 

Da requested her third loan from VisionFund, which she will use to purchase cassava seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for plowing. She hopes this loan can help her family live better than before.

loans.use: to purchase cassava seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha is 31 and a mother of two children; one is in school and one is too young for school. She is a rice farmer and she also works as a construction worker in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years. For Pha, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She is the group leader of a two-member group for this new loan. 

Pha will use this entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to upgrade her farm. She hopes she can gain a good yield and her family will do better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to upgrade her farm.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Battambang province, Samnang is 46 years old and a mother of six children. Currently, only two children are in school. She overcomes her family's hardships via rice farming. Besides this agricultural business, her husband can make extra income working as a solider and Samnang also uses her spare time to work for other for a fee. 

This is her fourth cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner ) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. Now, she is the leader of a group of two members. Samnang will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing cost for her farmland. She hopes this loan can help her family do better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing costs for her farmland.

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en:
Theary is 39 years old and married with four children. One of her children is too young to go to school while the other three are in school. She lives in the Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. Her main business is cassava farming on three hectares of farmland. The low price of cassava is the main challenge for her business.
 
This is the second loan for Theary with Kiva’s partner. The past loan has helped her better support her business as well as her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay labor fees for her farmland

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en: A resident in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Chanthol is 58 years old and a married mother of two kids. Her business is selling grocery items, which is the main source of her family's income. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Together, they can earn about 45,000 KHR per day. She has been with Kiva’s partner for one cycle already and her first loan has helped her to better support her living. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. Chanthol, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn a better income to support in her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Saiyet's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Saiyet is 63 years old. To support herself, she sells coffee as a source of income. Beside this business, she also grows longan for resale to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for ten years. For Saiyet, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan.
