In this group of two members, Saiyet is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to upgrade her coffee shop. She hopes that she can make more income from her coffee shop with this loan and can make her family's living conditions better than before.

loans.use: To upgrade her coffee shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Living in the rural area of Bovel district, Battambang province, Chanthou is 42 years old and married with five children. To make a living, she has been growing rice, soybeans and sesame for 10 years. She can earn about KHR 71,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Chanthou has been with VisionFund for eight cycles and completely paid back her loans. She is now going to use her loan to buy seeds for her farmland and a portion on plowing the field. She hopes to support her agricultural business in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farmland and spend a portion on plowing the field.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim is a 41-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are in school.  Now, her residential area is Battambang province where her cassava and rice are is grown. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is in her fourth loan cycle with a successful repayment of her former loans. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. 

For this cycle, she has teamed up in a group of two to get a new loan, and she is the leader. Sim will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fees. She hopes that this loan can support her needs in a timely manner so that she can make triple income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Sreymach's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Sreymach is 28 years old and has two dependent children. One is in school and one is too young for schooling. 

For the sake of her children and to earn a living, Sreymach grows cassava and works for others for a fee during her spare time.  

Now, she is in need of working capital. Therefore, she applied for a new loan by forming a group of six borrowers. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her crops. 

She greatly hopes that she can earn more income than before, so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her crops.

loans.name: Leat's Group

texts.en: Leat is a 40-year-old woman living in Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is too young for schooling and two who are in school. Because of her living, she earns money to support her family via cassava growing. She also farms rice to earn extra income. The current business earns her an income of about 30,300 KHR per day. For Leat, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group with three members, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm. She hopes she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en: Savoeurn is a resident of Battambang province. She overcomes her family’s financial burden via cassava growing as her main source of income. She sometimes works for others for a fee to increase her income.  This is the original loan for Savoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has teamed up in a group of three to get a new loan. She is the leader, and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and to pay plowing fees for her crop. She highly believes that she can make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay the plowing fees for her crop.

loans.name: Samyan's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Samyan is 40 years old and a mother of two children. She provides for her family's basic needs via rice cropping as the single business that she has had since she was 20 years old. Now, the shortage of working capital to support her business is her challenge. Therefore, she has teamed up in a group of two to get a new loan.

Samyan, a group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes this loan can help her farming growth be better than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Penh's Group

texts.en:
Penh, 48, lives in a rural area of the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province and she is married with two children. The family’s main sources of income are planting cassava, corn and rice. Penh has been in these businesses for 10 years. 

Penh is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she will use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to spend on labor and plowing. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Soem's Group

texts.en: Soem, a villager from Battambang province, is 47 years old. She is one of the breadwinners in her family. She strives for a living via rice cropping and has a paid-working job during her spare time.This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. Now, she has formed a group of two to get a new loan.  She is the group leader, and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, merchandise, and add personal touches to her store.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of Kam Rieng district, Battambang Cham province, Rorn is aged 33 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. She and her husband earn a living through selling grocery items while her husband is a taxi-driver to supplement their income. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 22,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the fourth loan for Rorn with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to fix the roof and to place metal sheeting around the house

loans.name: Kolab's Group

texts.en: Kolab, 36, is a mother of six children residing in Battambang province where her cash-crop, rice farming, is grown. Nowadays, she needs to support her remaining five children as one is too young for schooling and four are in school. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, she is leading a group of two to get a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can improve her living conditions and make them better than before.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en:
Rorn is 53 and widowed. She lives in a rural village of the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province and she has three children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava for 10 years. 

Rorn’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. She is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is a 45-year-old woman and she is a mother of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support two children who are in school. Her residential area is Battambang province where her rice is grown. She has been involved in her current business for 23 years. Besides this, she  earns extra income  to support her family via selling grocery items.

 For Mom, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. With  a group of three members, she is the leader of group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farm. She is hopeful this loan can help her farm gain a good yield so her family will do better than before.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Saranak's Group

texts.en:
Saranak, aged 45, is a villager from Sangke district in Battambang province. She is the mother of four children, but currently only one is in school. To deal with her daily cost of living, she grows cassava and works as a local school teacher in the area. Including this loan, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful repayment of her past loan enables her to improve her lifestyle gradually. 

Now, in a group of two, Saranak is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, to buy rice seed, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to support her business in a timely way so she can make more income than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, to buy rice seed, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Serey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Kam Rieng district of Cambodia, Serey is 33 years old and married with three children. To make a living, she has been working as a cassava farmer and sometimes she works for others for a fee. 

Serey is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business and make more income so she can make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Hunly

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Hunly is 43 years old and married. She is a mother of two children who are in school. 

Hunly's rice and sesame farming has earned her about KHR 16,000 per day to support her daily cost of living. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her cash-crop. Therefore, she applied for her first loan in order to pay for plowing fees.  

Hunly hopes that she can make a good income, better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some hand tools and construction equipment

loans.name: Mandarina Group 1

texts.en:
Elena is Mandarina Group 1 leader, the group is composed by 10 women, and they will use their loans in commercial and agricultural activities. Ten women are of Ethnicity Ixil Maya and one of Ethnicity Q'anjob'al Maya. On average each group member has 4.5 children. The average of their loans is Q 3,100.

Elena is 53 years old, mother of 13 children, 3 died, 8 are adults and 2 are studying in the school. Her dad died when she was 13, poverty in which she was made her to migrate from their place of origin to its current location, she lived in three different populations. Twenty years ago with her husband she introduced the sale of chicken meat in its population. It was a good business for a while, until other people began selling the same product, now she has a Commodity Store and sell chickens, this allows her to cover her financial needs.

Elena borrowed Q 5,000, and will invest in expanding their store. The loan will help support her family and she hopes to have Q 500 monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her commodity store

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, aged 52 and a married mother of seven children, is the only breadwinner in the family consisting of seven children.  For the sake of her family, she grows rice and sesame as the main business and supplements her income via her paid-working job.  

This is the third loan for Yon with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and now her living conditions are improving.  Now she has taken a new loan to pay for plowing fees, buy rice seed, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs.  She greatly hopes that she can replant her cash-crop seasonably so that she can earn additional income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, buy rice seed, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Chhorvon's Group

texts.en:
Chhorvon is a 50-year-old mother residing in Battambang province, where she raises her three schoolchildren. The main source of her income is from rice cropping, which she has been doing for several years, and it has returned her about 43,400 KHR per day.

This is the first loan cycle for Chhorvon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has joined a group of four to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farming. She hopes her farm can get a better harvest than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheeting, wood, nails, etc., to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Armando Isaac

texts.es:
Armando de 22 años de edad, soltero, con un hijo menor de edad, es originario de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Con mucho, esfuerzo y perseverancia, y ganas de triunfar en la vida luchar día a día para hacer prospero su negocio y cumplir metas sus mestas personales.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica el servicio cyber ubicado en su casa de habitación, negocio que le dedica una doce horas diarias ofreciendo el servicio de internet, fotocopias, llamadas telefónicas, etc.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de computadoras para brindar unos mejor servicios a sus clientes. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Armando agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Armando is 22 years old, he is single and has a small child. He is originally from Leon, a place in the north of the region. He is hard-working, responsible, and wants to get ahead. With great efforts and perseverance, and with the desire to succeed in life, he fights every day to make his business prosper and to achieve his personal goals. Thanks to his efforts and his will to get ahead, he has set up an internet café in his house. He works 12 hours every day in this business and offers internet service, photocopies, telephone calls, etc. 

He will use the loan to invest it in the purchase of computers, in order to offer better services to his customers. By this, he wants to generate more income in the not too distant future. 

Armando is thankful for the help the Kiva lenders offer to people with little resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can find a dignified occupation.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment like computers and modems to offer better services.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of one child, Khim is 29, and living in a rural village of the Kam Rieng district, Cambodia.  To support her family, she and her husband grow rice, soybeans, corn, and cassava as their main source of income.  They have been in this business for 10 years.

Khim is in her first cycle with VisionFund.  Now she is leading a group to seek a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor.  She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Chhoeum's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chhoeum is 47 years old. She is married and has six children. She struggles to make a living, since she does rice cropping as a single business. Now she is in need of working capital to support her farmland. Therefore, she has joined a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She also hopes this loan can help her farm produce a better harvest than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Ana Florinda

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo  mayor  de edad que aun vive con ellos. El marido no trabaja por enfermedad.
Doña Ana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante ya que su marido está enfermo y no puede trabajar, ella es el único sostén de su familia y por eso se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en las afueras de la iglesia de la localidad donde vende llaveros, bisutería, imágenes, escapularios y reliquias todas con motivos religiosos,  son muchos los fieles que llegan todos los días a  su ciudad por lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas ya que sus productos son muy apreciadas por sus clientes, ya son más de 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar imágenes, llaveros, escapularios, reliquias y todo de lo que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Del Nuevo Milenio” (Women of the New Millenium) is a group that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.
Here is where Ana lives. She is 66 years old, she is married and she has an adult son who still lives with them. Her husband does not work because of an illness.
Ana is a woman who likes working to get ahead in life, as her husband is sick and he not able to work. She is the only one supporting her family, and for this reason she engages in retailing. She owns a shop outside the church of her community, where she sells key rings, custom jewelry, religious images, saints’ medals and all kinds of religious votive offerings. There are many believers coming to her town every day, and for this reasons her sales are very good, as her customers like her products very much. She has been engaging in this activity for more than 30 years, and this is how she gets ahead.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy religious images, key rings, saints’ medals, votive offerings and all the other products that she sells. She has been a member of this group since the beginning, and she likes it because she can fund her activity thanks to the loans. Her dream is that her family and herself can enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy religious images, key rings, saints’ medals and votive offerings.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Son, a local farmer Battambang province, is 50 years old and married. She is a mother of ten children, three of whom are still under her dependency as one is too young for schooling and two are in school.  Her entire family solely counts on the rice-cropping business and the paid-working job during spare time. 

Now, she is in need of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can boost her crop yield higher than before.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Ruom's Group

texts.en:
Aged 42 and a local farmer from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Ruom is a mother of seven children. Nowadays, she needs to support only two children as they are still in school. 

To overcome the financial burden for her household, she raises pigs as the main source of income and works for others for a fee. Ruom is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely. 

Now, she teams up a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more piglets for raising. She highly hopes that she can raise her pigs healthily so she can make more income.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for raising.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Nhor, aged 53 and living in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district, has eight children. She and her husband are farmers who have grown cassava for 35 years. To supplement the income, she also works as a garment worker. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth microloan for Nhor with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy zinc for renovating her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy zinc for renovating her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Tharath's Group

texts.en:
Tharath, 40 and a mother of one kid, is villager from Bovel district of Battambang province.  She makes a living via rice and cassava farming. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. This is the original loan for Tharath with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner).  

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. Tharath will spend her entire loan portion to pay a plowing fee and to buy cassava seedlings. She high hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and to buy cassava seedlings.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three children, aged in her early 30's and residing in Battambag province, Sinoun is a local farmer who strives for a living via rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for several years and it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan cycle for Sinuon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely and now her living condition is improved gradually. 

Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fee.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang is a villager from Thmor Koul district in Battambang province. She is 54 years old, and a married mother blessed with five children. To earn a living, she grows rice and raises fish as her main sources of income. Now, she is short of working capital to support her rice cropping. Therefore, she gets a new loan to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer to boost her crop yield and to buy fish feed. She hopes that she can make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and to buy fish feed.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province where her cassava is grown on a five-hectare area, Ny is a mother of six children and is 44 years old. 

Besides her agribusiness, she spends her spare time to work for others for a fee. Ny, a former borrower who has fully repaid her past loan, forms a group of two to get a new loan. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy herbicide for her cassava. She hopes that she can get a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy herbicide for her cassava.

loans.name: Samot's Group

texts.en:
Samot, 44, is a farmer from Battambang province. She has three children, one of whom is in school. 

To struggle for a living, she grows rice and runs a grocery stall as the main business. This is not the original loan for Samot with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan wisely and her living condition is getting better than before. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. Samot will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain triple the income she had before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, timber, nails, and the like to build a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to deliver his bakery's bread

loans.name: Beronica Del Pilar

texts.es:
Beronica del Pilar tiene 35 años de edad, reside en el distrito de Buenos aires, vive en casa propia; ella es natural de la zona. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y su población se dedica a ala agricultura, ganadería, y además del comercio. Dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Beronica del Pilar es a la cría y venta de aves de corral como pavos y patos; esta actividad la realiza los días viernes, sábados y domingos en su domicilio y cuando es necesario reparte pedidos a los caseríos cercanos. Ella cuenta con clientela fija en la zona y con mucha experiencia en el negocio.

Beronica del Pilar tiene capacidad de pago, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos y por la mayoria de la población de la comunidad donde vive. Beronica del Pilar solicita el crédito para la compra y venta de animales, ya que ella desea aumentar su stock y diversificarlo, porque desea comprar otro tipo de animales como pollos, conejos, cuyes entre otros. Lo que le va a permitir aumentar sus ingresos, dado que sus ventas aumentarán porque podrá satisfacer los diferentes gustos de su público consumidor.
texts.en:
Beronica del Pilar is 35 years old and lives in the district of Buenos Aires. She lives in her own house. She is a native of the area. Life in the community is quiet and its population is engaged in agriculture and also trade. This district is located in the province of Morropón in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

The activity that Beronica del Pilar dedicates herself to is the sale of poultry such as turkeys and ducks. This activity takes place on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays at her home and when necessary orders are distributed to nearby villages. She has a shop in the area with lots of experience in the business.

Beronica del Pilar has the ability to repay and has good personal and professional references from her neighbors and most of the community where she lives. Beronica del Pilar is seeking a loan for the purchase of animals to sell because she wants to increase her stock and diversify. She wants to buy other animals such as chickens, rabbits, guinea pigs, and more which will allow her to increase her revenue and sales when she satisfies the different tastes of consumers.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, rabbits, guinea pigs, and other animals

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en: Sokchea is a villager who lives in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married woman who has one child to support. Her child attends school. To secure the need in her household, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland. To supplement the family’s income, her husband works at a construction site during his spare time. This is the second loan cycle for Sokchea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and now she takes a new loan in order to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she will have enough capital for doing her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Tha is a 53-year-old mother of six children. Rice planting has been the only source for her family’s income to make a living for 33 years. Sometimes, her husband also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Tha has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Tha, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Hary's Group

texts.en:
Hary is a married mother of three children and she lives in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is 43 years old, and she does rice farming as the main source of her family’s support. Sometimes, her husband works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs.

She has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, and spend a portion of it to pay plowing fees. She hopes to get high yields from her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokkhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sokhouern lives in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is 37 years old and married with 3 dependent children. She works as a rice farmer to make a living and her husband works as a construction worker to earn additional income. She has been in this business for 17 years. 

She has been with VisionFund for four cycles and now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Poeurn's Group

texts.en:
Poeurn is 57 years old and a married mother, blessed with six children. She earns a living via rice and sesame farming and a paid-working job, to secure the basic needs in her household. 

This is the first loan for Poeurn with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. 

As the leader, Poeurn will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She greatly hopes that she can make a good income, better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Roun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district, Roun is a 54-year-old married mother of seven children. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for seven years. To better support the family, she also works as a paid worker. Lack of working capital to support her business is the main challenge.
 
This is a group loan for Roun through VisionFund. This is the third cycle for her. The past loans have helped Roun to better support her family and increase the business. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Roun, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 41 years old and a mother of four children. 

She strives for a living via rice cropping which generates her about 31,900 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Tha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and now her living condition is getting better than before. 

Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to plant her cash-crop on time so that she can make a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients and packaging for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Vân is 34 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives with 3 dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Vân works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Vân is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 thôn 9 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is Vân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell. 

The main hardship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Samoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Samoeurn is 43 years old and a mother of two children. 

She earns a living via running a grocery stall and doing a paid-working job.  This is not the first loan for Samoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and now she forms a group of two to get a new loan. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can support her business on time so that she can make a good income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Ruon

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Roun is aged 50 years and married with eight children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living and support her family, she has been in the farming business for 11 years. The current business earns her about 60,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
 
This is the first micro loan for Roun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Thouk is aged 45 years and married. She has four children. To support the family, she and her husband have been faming rice for 11 years. The current business earns her family about 17,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Thouk has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she successfully used the past loans to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase the income for supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Dav's Group

texts.en:
Dav is aged 30 years and married with one kid living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working as a teacher which they have been doing for 7 years. The current business earns them about 47,000KHR per day and they manage to save about 30,000KHR each day for future needs. 

Dav’s group consists of two female members who have been members of VisionFund for two cycles. Dav successfully used the first loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labors. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Vuochchheng's Group

texts.en:
Vuochchheng is 47 years old and a married mother of six children. She is a resident of Banteay Meanchey province where her porridge-selling business is run and her vegetable garden is grown. Her multiple sources of income have returned her about 44,500 KHR per day to overcome her family’s hardship. 

Now, she is in need of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her vegetable garden. She hopes to make more income better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her vegetable garden.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chantei's Group

texts.en:
Chantei is from the Battambang province in Moung Russey district. She is 20 years old, and she is married and blessed with two children, both of whom are too young for school. To make a living, she does rice farming.

She leads her group to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) of 1,000,000 KHR each. This is the third loan cycle for her. The past loans have helped her better support her living. As the leader, she will use her portion of her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay plowing fees. She hopes she will get high yields from her rice paddy to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is aged 39 years and married with two children, who are still in school. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Phnom Prek district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice which they have been doing for ten years. The current business earns them about 37,000KHR per day. 

Touch’s group consists of two female members who live in the same district. Touch has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Felix Benigno

texts.es:
El  señor  Félix  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposa y 3 hijos en  un caserío al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta de refrescos naturales y pan de manera ambulante, desde hace más de 6 años.
 El señor Félix  necesita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar,  colorantes,  frutas, panes, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Don Félix espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en el negocio más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la   sociedad y  ayudar  a su  familia. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Agosto   del   2014
texts.en:
Felix is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person. He lives with his wife and three children in a village in southern Honduras. His business is selling natural drinks and bread as a street vendor for the past 6 years,

Felix needs a long to purchase sugar, food coloring, fruits, bread, and more. With the loan, he expects to increase sales in his business and have more products to offer and better serve his customers.

Felix hopes to cover the needs that he has and give a little better quality of life to his family. In a few years, he expects his business to continue to grow and become the largest and most recognized business in the area. He hopes his children become good people, have better opportunities in society, and help his family.

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to purchase sugar, food coloring, fruit, and more to make drinks

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is aged 37 years, married, and lives in a wooden house located in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. She has four children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 10 years and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 70,000KHR per day and they manage to save about 40,000KHR each day for future needs. 

Sophea has just been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Grupo La Jerusalen Group

texts.en: El grupo Jerusalén está integrado por tres socias exitosas, una de ellas es Cándida mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera y desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva de adulto.Con  el prestamo lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropa de calidad de camisas, shores, jeans de varon y mujer y vestidos, lo que significa que va a diversificar su negocio con la venta de ropa nueva asi como la venta de ropa usada. Paula tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de  lotería y raspaditas en los diferentes  mercados de la capital y Maria tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de lotería y raspaditas.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, shorts, jeans and dresses.

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
Sokunthea is aged 35 years and married with four children. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for seven years to make a living, and she supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn about 70,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs, and is able to save about 50,000KHR each day for future needs. 

Sokunthea is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokunthea will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her current business to earn a larger income, and also hopes to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Naren's Group

texts.en:
Naren is 45 years old and married with one kid. She lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for 20 years. She also sells grocery items to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her family about 28,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Naren has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the loans which have helped her family with sufficient food and better support for the business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village located in the Sithor Kandal district of Kampong Cham province, Tom is 55 years old and has six children, two of whom are in school. Tom makes a living through farming rice, which she and her husband have been doing for 35 years. They earn about 54,000KHR but are able to save about 20,000KHR each day.

This is the first cycle for Tom with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Tom will use her portion to buy fertilizers and gasoline for supporting her farming business. She hopes to increase her income to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline for supporting her farming business

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom, aged 61, lives in a rural village of the Koh Sontin district and has nine children. She and her husband are rice farmers in the area to make a living. She has been in this business for 41 years. The current business earns them for 50,000KHR per day.

This is the micro loan for Sokhom’s group of two members who are both female and are in their second cycle with VisionFund. The past loan that Sokhom completely repaid has helped her relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. Now with this new loan, Sokhom, who is the group leader, will use her portion to plow the rice field. She hopes to make more crops to make her daily living conditions better.

loans.use: to plow the rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Sokheng, a 58-year-old mother of two, lives in a rural village in the Koh Sotin district. Involved in fishing and weaving mats, the main sources of her family’s income for about 38 years, she earns a daily income of about 30,000KHR, out of which she is able to save 15,000KHR each day. 

The leader of a group of two, Sokheng is requesting her first loan to buy a cast net and other supplies for her fishing business. She hopes these purchases will improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a cast net and other supplies for her fishing business

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Willian

texts.es:
El señor William es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con sus hijos y esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 10 años. 
El señor William  necesita el préstamo  para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carne, pollo, refrescos,  etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten sus ingresos al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
El señor  William  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar  su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de los negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando a  sus padres e hijos  ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos. 	


Choluteca, Honduras  – Agosto   del   2014
texts.en:
William is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. He lives with his children and wife in the south of Honduras. He has had a grocery store for more than 10 years. 

William needs a loan to buy butter, rice, beans, beef, chicken, soft drinks, etc. He hopes that the loan will help him better look after his customers and improve his sales and income thanks to having more products on offer. 

William hopes to cover his current needs and improve his quality of life and that of his family. He hopes that his business will continue growing in a few years and that it will become one of the largest and best known businesses in the area. He also hopes to continue supporting his parents and children, as they have a limited income. Choluteca, Honduras -- August 2014.

loans.use: to buy butter, rice, beans, beef, chicken, soft drinks, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Jonathan Alberto

texts.es: Jonathan es un joven de 27 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos que aún tiene a su cargo. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura actividad a la que se ha dedicado hace 10 años. Dio inicio a esta actividad cuando tenía la edad de 17 años cuando ayudado por sus hermanos logro sembrar frijoles y con grandioso éxito logro sacar las cosecha desde entonces ha dedicado parte su vida a esta actividad que le ha gustado mucho. Jonathan solicita un préstamo para cuidar de su actual siembra de maíz y arroz secano comprando abono orgánico, que gracias a sus componentes naturales obtendrá una excelente cosecha. Sus planes futuros son seguir creciendo y trabajando fuertemente para brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jonathan is a 27 year-old married father of 3 children who are still his dependents. His main economic activity is agriculture, which he has been doing for 10 years. He started this activity when he was 17 years old when, with his brothers’ help, he planted beans and had a very successful harvest. Since then, he has devoted part of his life to this activity, which he really enjoys. 

Jonathan is requesting a loan to care for his current corn and upland rice crops by buying organic compost, which, thanks to its natural ingredients, will produce an excellent harvest. His future plans are to continue growing and working hard to provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: to care for his current corn and upland rice crops by buying organic compost.

loans.name: Sithet's Group

texts.en:
Sithet, 39, lives with her three dependent children in a village in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. All of her children are too young for school. 

Sithet has been farming rice for almost 19 years and supplements the family’s income by working as a garment worker. She is able to earn about 41,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sithet is requesting her first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. The leader of a group of four, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to produce more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Mrs. Hue is a hardworking woman, 42 years old. She is married and has three children. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. Her main income sources are husbandry and fishing so she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising and fish selling, which her husband catches.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Dany's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Kam Rieng district, Dany is a 45-year-old mother of three children. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and selling grocery items. To add more income, her husband also works as a motor-taxi driver. Dany and her husband have been in this business for 6 years. 

This is the fourth loan for Dany with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Dany wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pay for plowing the rice fields. She will use a portion of it to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to resell.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, La, 38, has three dependent children in total. Two are in school while another one is too young for school.  La and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 20 years to make a living. The current business earns her about 36,000KHR per day to support the family.

La has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to better support her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Kert's Group

texts.en:
Kert, 30, is married with four dependent children, two of whom are still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice. She has been running her business for several years, earning about KHR 30,000 per day, and she is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day.

Kert is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income so she can make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: This is Hannah. She is a single mother with three children of whom two are in high school. She is from Kiambu, Kenya where she is involved in small scale farming and dairy keeping. Hannah was challenged after the death of her dairy cow, as her income fell below her sustainable levels. Her wish is to have more dairy cows and increase her income to educate her children without strain. A loan from Kiva will help her replace the dead cow and restore her income to the previous level.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods such as chicken, oil, flour, and to carry out some renovations to her kiosk.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Félix Pedro  es una persona responsable, trabajadora, honesta, vive  con su esposa 2 hijos en un caserío  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta de refrescos naturales ambulante, desde hace más de 12 años. 
Don Félix Pedro lo necesita para la compra de  azúcar,  colorantes,  frutas,  etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Don  Félix espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en un negocio más prospero  y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la   sociedad y  ayudar  a su  familia. 	


Choluteca, Honduras  –  Agosto   del   2014
texts.en:
Félix Pedro is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person.  He lives with his wife and two children in a small village in southern Honduras.  His business is mobile sales of natural fruit drinks.  He has been doing this for more than 12 years.

Don Félix Pedro needs this to buy sugar, dye, fruits, etc. He hopes that with this loan his sales will increase due to having more products to offer and better customer service.

Don Félix hopes to take care of the needs that he has and improve his and his family's quality of life a little.  In a few years he hopes that his business will keep growing and become a more prosperous business, well-known throughout the area.  He hopes that his children will become people of means and have better opportunities in society and help their family.

Choluteca, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy sugar, dyes, and fruit

loans.name: Graciela Berenisse

texts.es: Graciela de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y dos sobrinos de 18 y 16 años de edad. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo pupusas en su cantón, además vende tortas de pan con aguacate, escabeche, jamón, queso, kétchup, etc. Graciela es una joven responsable que apoya a su madre con la economía familiar, y viendo la necesidad de reparar el techo del corredor de su vivienda ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Graciela, age 23, lives in her own home together with her mother and two nephews, ages 16 and 18.  She is an enterprising young woman who earns her living making and selling pupusas [a traditional treat] in her neighborhood.  Additionally, she sells sandwiches with avocado, pickled vegetables, ham, cheese, ketchup, etc.  

Graciela is a responsible young woman who supports her mother with the family finances.  Seeing the need to repair the roof of the outdoor patio on their home, she has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails in order to repair the roof on her home's covered patio

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: This is Josphine. She is a small scale dairy farmer in Kiambu, Kenya. She is married and has five children, of which three are in high school. Josphine has plans of growing her milk production to 30 litres of milk per day. Since her husband is unemployed, she is the main income earner in the family. A loan from Kiva will help Josphine buy another cow and put her in the right path for realizing her dream.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ouk's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Ont, 47, has four children. Ouk is a farmer who has been growing mango for 15 years to make a living. Besides this, she also sells vegetables in a local market. The current business earns her about 18,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Ouk has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a proper motorbike for helping her in transporting vegetables to the market. She hopes to reduce some expenses on motor-taxi drivers and also hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy a proper motorbike.

loans.name: Lao's Group

texts.en:
Lao, 51, lives with two children in a village of Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother. To make a living, she has struggled to feed her children by farming rice, and she supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. 

Lao has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Yeth's Group

texts.en:
Yeth, 48, lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Of her five children, she has two who are still in school. To feed the family, Yet and her husband earn a living as farmers, and they have been raising pigs and working for others for a fee for seven years, earning about 46,000KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs. 

Yeth has been with VisionFund for seven cycles already. She completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feeds for nourishing her pigs. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds for nourishing her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, gravel, metal sheeting, wood, etc., in order to build a water cistern and bathroom.

loans.name: Eth's Group

texts.en:
Eth, 55, lives in a rural area of the Mong Russey district of Battambang province and she is married with seven children. The family’s main source of income is from farming rice. She has been in this business for 35 years. She can earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Eth has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her relieve family burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor and land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is aged 41 and married. She has three children. Living in a village of the Moungkul Borey district, Sokha is a nurse in a local area. To supplement her income, she also farms rice. She has been in this business for 21 years. 

This is the first loan for Sokha with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Paskazia’S Group

texts.en:
Paskazia and her group members share their gratitude and thanks to Kiva lenders for their previous loan. They shared their story on how their Kiva loan enabled them  to expand their vegetable farming project. They now are the leading suppliers of vegetables in their community, including for neighboring schools. 

Paskazia used part of her income to pay school fees for her child at the university, and she has used the balance to buy 3 goats for rearing. 

However, Paskazia and her group members highlighted food security as their major challenge. It is for this reason that they are asking for a new loan to buy good quality seeds and pay for workers to cultivate their land for crop farming. Paskazia believes growing crops like maize and beans will help her and her household members attain food security.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and pay workers for crop farming.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre humilde y trabajador que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Medellín desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación y venta de alimentos como empanadas y pasteles, además de preparar jugos y salpicón.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen a Eduardo y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Eduardo desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra una greca para preparar tinto y comprar insumos como harina y carne para sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a humble and hardworking man that has spent a large part of his life caring for his children. 

He lives in the town of Medellin where he performs spectacularly in the kitchen as his business is the preparation and sale of food such as turnovers and cakes as well as preparing juices and ground beef. This food is sold primarily to neighbors in the area who know Eduardo and know that they will always get delicious and well prepared food.

Eduardo wants to increase food sales and want to work in a more suitable way which is why he is asking for a loan to buy a coffee machine to prepare coffee and to buy supplies such as flour and meat for his recipes. 

This loan will allow him to get ahead in business so he can obtain the necessary earnings to give him the opportunity to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy a coffee machine to prepare coffee and to buy supplies such as flour and meat for his recipes

loans.name: Dorothy’S Group

texts.en:
Dorothy and her group members thank Kiva lenders for their previous loan. As a result of this loan, members reported increased vegetable production, incomes and knowledge on better farming practices. 

Dorothy used part of her income to renovate her home, and she established a small retail shop that helps her earn a daily income.

Dorothy and her group members have now mastered vegetable growing, and want to start maize and bean farming. Therefore, they ask for this loan to buy good quality seeds, pay for farm workers and obtain more training on maize and bean farming.

loans.use: to purchase good quality maize and bean seeds and get training on better farming practices.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of seven children, Mom is aged 45 living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She still has two children who are in school. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice and work for others for a fee as main sources of family’s income and they have been in this business for 34 years. 

Mom has been with VisionFund for three cycles and now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Aged 33 years old, Seang is a rural villager from the Mungkul Borey district earning a living through farming rice and raising pigs as her only main source of family’s income. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has three children; two are in school while another one is too young for school. She is able to earn about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Seang has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Seang, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying farming supplies. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province, Srey is a 34-year-old mother of three children. Rice planting has been the only source for her family’s income to make a living for 14 years. To add up more income, she also sells fish paste in a local area. 

Srey has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She successfully paid back the past loans. Now she is applying for another loan to buy a decent tuk tuk (vehicle for using as a taxi) for her husband in order to earn more income for supporting her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her new business.

loans.use: to buy a decent tuk tuk

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
From a rural village from the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Mao is aged 46 years and married with two children who are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing cassava. She has been in this business for almost 10 years. 

Mao has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one loan cycle and successfully paid back her past loan with VisionFund. The loan from VisionFund has helped her family relieve the business. Currently, she is able to earn about KHR 56,000 per day. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is aged 34 and married. He lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and he has three children, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, he has been in rice farming for 15 years earning about 60,000 KHR per day. 

Horn’s group consists of two male members and he is in his second micro-loan with VisionFund. Now he is leading his group to seek another loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields and earn more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy For All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. She is employed and mother of family, age 50 years; she is married and has eight children. It is clear that Maria works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, their children will be able to do their homework and improve the living conditions.
Maria is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending on kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Sevin

texts.en:
Sevin lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is a farmer (coffee and cacao), age 28 years; he is married and has one child. It is clear that Sevin works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his sons will be able to do their homework and improve the living conditions.
Sevin is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit him to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending on kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Julia Suyapa

texts.es:
La  señora Julia  es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y  humilde vive con su esposo e hijos en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio son lo cosméticos  el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad. 
Doña  Julia necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como lociones,  cremas,  talcos,  perfumes, desodorantes, desinfectantes, etc. espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los productos  necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y que sus  ventas tengan un  aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Doña  Julia espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad  y  de esa manera seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijos continúen con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre   del  2014
texts.en:
Julia is a very hardworking, responsible, and humble person.  She lives with her husband and children in a community in Southern Honduras.  Cosmetics are her business, and it is well-known in her community.

Doña Julia needs this loan to buy merchandise such as lotions, creams, powders, perfumes, deodorants, disinfectants, etc.  She hopes to be able, thanks to this loan, to have all the products she needs to keep her business going.  In this way she can meet her customers’ demands, and her sales can increase considerably.  This will be reflected in her family’s quality of life.

Doña Julia hopes that her business will keep growing and will become the best-known in the community.  In this way she can keep supporting her family and her children can continue with their studies and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras — September 2014

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, powders, perfumes, deodorants, disinfectants, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Ei

texts.en:
Ei, 38, is married with two children residing in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children are still in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice for eight years while her husband works as a worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 44,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

Ei is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en: Sokny, 42, is married and resides in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. She has six children, three of whom are in school. For the last 20 years, she has been farming rice and selling cans and somethings for recycling. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. Sokny has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her farming business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Mrs. Huyen is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to sustain her family. Husbandry, fishing and a small salary are the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's living standards as well as environment protection.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Dien

texts.en: Mrs. Dien is 48 years old. She is married and has four children, three of them have a job. She has been operating a fish selling business for the past three years. She needs the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve her living conditions and health for her family. Her income is mainly from business and fishing so she has regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Alberto Antonio

texts.es: Alberto de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus padres. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida haciendo viajes en vehículo propio, y es gracias a ello que logra sostener la economía familiar por medio de su esfuerzo. Alberto ha construido un cuarto dormitorio pero no logro colocarle ladrillo de piso, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena para colocarle ladrillo de piso a su cuarto dormitorio.
texts.en:
Alberto, age 25, lives in his own home together with his life companion and his parents.  He is an enterprising man who earns his living making trips in his own vehicle.  It is thanks to this that he takes care of the family finances, through his efforts.  

Alberto has built a bedroom, but he didn’t manage to install a brick floor.  Because of this, he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in brick flooring, cement, and sand, in order to install a brick floor in his bedroom.

loans.use: to buy brick flooring, cement, and sand to install a brick floor in his bedroom.

loans.name: Riad

texts.en:
Riad is a 50 year old Palestinian refugee who was born in a refugee camp located in South Lebanon where he also grew up. He is married and has three children with his wife who was also raised inside the refugee camp.
He has been working for more than 25 years in the construction industry and more specifically in metal works and steel welding. His work is well known in the area for being neat and honest which encourages his children, who are in their last years of school, to take over the family business. 
Riad is asking for a 2,057,996 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He plans to use the loan to renew and expand his equipment kit in order to improve his business performance, serve new areas in the camp and increase his income. Thus, he will be able to provide his wife and three children with better living conditions despite the harsh and unstable socio-economic situation that has been going on in the camps.

loans.use: to buy electrical tools and equipment

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28 year old Palestinian refugee who grew up with his parents in a Palestinian camp located in North Lebanon. He currently lives with his wife and their three children. His wife is unemployed and the children are in their first years of school. 
Like his father, Mohammad has been working as a taxi driver inside the camp since 2009 to support his family. In order to provide a better service, he has recently bought a new car that needs registration and maintenance. 
Mohammad is asking for a 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He plans to use the loan to finish the required registration procedure for his new car and cover its maintenance costs. 
The loan will therefore allow him to provide his customers with a better service in addition to attracting new clients and providing his wife and kids with better living conditions. The registration of his car will also allow him to expand his services to areas outside the camp where he will be able to work legally.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs of his car

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, age 46, is a farmer in Kabwe, Zambia. Peter has been growing onion, cabbage and fresh greens to sell to buyers at local markets in Zambia’s Central region. He plans to get a water pump that will help him realize his goals of further expanding his farm.

Water pumps can be a major boost for rural farmers such as Peter, who often struggle to irrigate their crops using watering cans and buckets. A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. 

Rent to Own has worked with Peter and will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides Peter with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.ru:
Сафармох 59 лет. Она и вся ее семья занимается животноводством. Этот семейный бизнес они продвигают уже более 30 лет. 
Сафармох живет в предгорном районе А.Джоми. В этом районе имеются все условия для ведения деятельности животноводства, так как тут много пастбищ и хороших трав. Сафармох в основном выращивает коров и бычков для дальнейшей продажи. За счет кредита она хотела бы увеличить поголовье своего скота. Купив еще пару крупнорогатых скотин, она увеличит прибыльность бизнеса. Поэтому данный кредит ей действительно важен.
