texts.en: Safarmoh is 59 and works in animal husbandry along with her whole family, a business they have had for more than 30 years. She lives in the A. Jomi region near the mountains, where there is a lot of good pasture and grasses that make the area good for raising livestock. Safarmoh mostly raises cows and steers for further resale. With this loan she would like to increase her head count of animals by buying a pair of cattle and therefore increasing her business income. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es: Willian de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 11 años de edad. Èl es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza cada día por sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a su trabajo como motorista de transporte publico. Willian desea reparar el techo y encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lamina y polines para reparar el techo y encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Willian is 36 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and 11 year old daughter. He is a hardworking man who struggles every day to support his family through his work as a public transport driver. 

Willian wants to repair the roof and put in a concrete floor in the house hallway which is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, sheeting and beams in order to repair the roof and lay a concrete floor in the hallway of his house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, sheeting and beams to repair the roof and put in a cement floor in the hallway of his home

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally is aged 50 years and married with three dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, and earns a living through farming rice. She can earn about KHR 50,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 25,000 each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Phally with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sithan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched-roof house in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Sithan is aged 60 years old and widowed. She has four children. She earns a living through farming rice and working as a tailor, and has been in this business for almost twenty years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 30,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the third loan for Sithan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, Sithan will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crop yields and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa de su suegra junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora quien hace todo lo que esta en sus manos para dar a su familia lo necesario. Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, pupusas y tortas. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su deseo es poder contar con casa propia y dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones habitacionales. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios para la construcción de la vivienda como: madera, cemento, arena, lámina, ladrillos, clavos, etc. Está muy agradecida por el crédito recibido anteriormente el cual ha logrado cancelar de manera satisfactoria.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 23 years old.  She lives in her mother-in-law’s home along with her husband and two children.  She is a very enterprising woman who does everything in her power to give her family what they need.  For two years she has been selling tortillas, pupusas [a traditional treat], and sandwiches.  She earns a living in this way and takes care of the household expenses.  

Her desire is to have her own house and give her children better living conditions.  Because of this, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as wood, cement, sand, metal sheeting, bricks, nails, etc.  

She is very grateful for the loan she received before, which she managed to pay off in a satisfactory manner.

loans.use: to buy wood, cement, sand, metal sheeting, bricks, nails, etc., to build a home.

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es:
Orlando de 29 años de edad, por falta de recursos económico solo estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, está casado y con su esposa han procreado 2 hijos. Únicamente su esposa y sus hijos viven y dependen de él.

Orlando tiene un negocio de venta de comida, vende platillos chinos y mejicanos, entre otros. Aprendió en el extranjero cuando trabajo en un restaurante como mesero. Hoy en dia tiene un local en su casa y trabaja de 8:00 am hasta 10:00 pm.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar productos para el negocio, no solo para la elaboración del alimento sino también mesas y sillas para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Orlando se proyecta tener un negocio más grande, contratar personal que lo apoye y con los ingresos dar el estudio universitario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Orlando is 29 years old. He only studied through the 6th grade of primary school because of a lack of economic resources. He is married and has fathered 2 children with his wife. He is the sole support of his wife and children.

Orlando has a business selling food. He sells Chinese and Mexican dishes, among others. He learned abroad when working in a restaurant as a waiter. Today he has a facility in his home and works from 8:00AM until 10:00PM.

He will use the loan to buy products for the business, not just for making food but also tables and chairs to offer better service to his customers.

Orlando is planning to have a larger business, to hire staff to support it and with the earnings put his children through college.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Amaro

texts.es:
Amaro tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es Conviviente. Tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos(agua y luz). Amaro vive en el distrito de San Juan de Bigotes, él es natural de la zona. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado menor comercio de guayaquil y arroz; dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Amaro es la siembra y comercialización de arroz y crianza de animales menores(patos, chivos, pollos, entre otros). Amaro necesita del crédito para usarlo como capital de trabajo, pues desea comprar ganado vacuno para poner una carniceria, y poder vender las carnes de este ganado; lo que le generá mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amaro is 31 years old.  His relationship status is “living with someone.”  He has his own house, where he has public utilities (water and electricity).  Amaro lives in the San Juan de Bigotes district; he is native to the area.  The community is a small one.  The people who live there raise cattle, engage in minor commerce in Guayaquil, and grow rice.  This district is located in the Morropón province, in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Amaro’s line of work is the raising and selling of rice and the raising of small animals  (ducks, goats, and chickens, among others).  Amara needs a loan to use as working capital, because he wants to buy cattle in order to open a butcher’s shop and to sell the meat from his herd.  This would generate better earnings and income and, in the end, would give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to open a butcher's shop

location.town: San Juan de Bigote - Morropon - Piura

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru:
Ойша пожилая жительница района Кубадиён, ей 62 года. Но несмотря на свой возраст она все еще активно трудится и занимается торговлей. Ойша продает продукты питания на лавке, а также занимается куплей и продажей миндаля. Этот бизнес очень развит на районе Кубадиён.
Ойша замужняя женщина, ее муж пенсионер. С ними также живут сын, невестка и внуки. Сын находится на заработках в России. В торговой деятельности Ойши помогают муж, невестка и к тому же внуки. Ойша берет кредит для купли партии миндаля для перепродажи. Она хочет увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Oysha is an elderly resident of the Qubadiyon region of Tajikistan.  She's married and lives with her retired husband, daughter-in-law, grandchildren, and her son, who is currently in Russia as a migrant worker.  She is 62 years old, but still actively working in spite of her age; she operates a stall offering snacks and other food items for sale, and deals in almonds on the side.  Her business in Qubadiyon is flourishing, and her husband, daughter-in-law and grandchildren all have a hand in it as well.  To bolster her family's finances, Oysha is seeking a loan to buy a load of almonds and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: buy almonds for resale

loans.name: Hurber

texts.es:
Hurber es un padre de familia dedicado, con una hermosa familia conformada por su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace más de 15 años viene dedicándose a la agricultura, con mucho éxito pudo comprar un pequeño terreno y se dedica al cultivo de cacao, con esto ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida.
Hurber está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar abono para sus cultivos y realizar los gastos de mantenimiento, así su producción mejorará y seguirá luchando para poder comprar más terrenos y plantar más cultivos.
texts.en:
Hurber is a dedicated parent with a beautiful family consisting of his wife and their three children.  For more than 15 years he has worked in agriculture with great success.  He managed to buy a small plot of land and works cultivating cacao.  With this he has been able to get his family ahead and give them better living conditions.

Hurber is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the help they have given him he will be able to buy fertilizer for his plants and take care of the expenses associated with maintenance.  In this way his production levels will improve and he can keep pushing ahead to be able to buy more land and plant more crops.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to his cacao plants and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Thuyet

texts.en: Mrs. Thuyet is a hard working woman of 40 years old. She is married and has two children, who are go to school. Her income is mainly from husbandry, agriculture and a small salary. With more than 15 years of experience and the support from her husband, her income is able to repay the loan monthly as requested. She is interested in improving the living standards of her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen is a farmer of 36 years old and she is married. She has two kids under 18 year old. She would like to improve her living standard, especially for her children but she lacks of capital. The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine. Farming is main income source of her family and she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kandal province where her rice is grown, Khon is 58 years old and is a mother of one child. Besides her agribusiness, she grows vegetables to earn extra income to better support her family. She has involved her current business for 10 years, and currently it returns her about 43,300 KHR per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she has repaid her previous loan completely. As the leader of a group consisting of three members, she will use this loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer, as well as plow the field to upgrade her farm. 

She hopes that she can make more income than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer, as well as plow the field to upgrade her farm.

loans.name: Sreyroth's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sreyroth is 30 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. The main sources of her income are from rice farming and a construction job. 

This is her first time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. In a group of three, Sreyroth is the group leader. Sreyroth will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that this loan can boost a good yield from her cash-crop so that she can get a lot of profit to raise some cows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee plants in this new season

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two children who lives in Kampong Cham province, Phuong is 42 years old. To struggle for her living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for ages and she earns about 46,400 KHR per day. 

For Phuong, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid her past loan completely. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan, and she is a group leader. For Phuong, she will spend this money to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that this loan can help her have enough capital to upgrade her farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a 57-year-old woman residing in Kampong Cham province. She has five children. As one of the breadwinners in the family, she grows rice and tailors clothes as her main sources of income. This returns her about 36,100 KHR per day. 

This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She forms a group of three to get this loan and she is the leader. For Touch, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pay for labour costs, and buy some pesticide. She hopes that this loan can make her farm get a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labour costs, and buy some pesticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Saen's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Saen is 43 years old and widowed. The main sources of her family’s income are farming rice and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 10 years. The current business earns her about 76,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is the eighth loan for Saen with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has fully repaid the loans. She is now leading her group to seek a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokyeang's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Pursat province, Sokyeang is 50 years old and a mother of 5 children. She earns a living through rice farming, which she has done for thirty years. 

For Sokyeang, this is her first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm. She is hopeful that this loan can support her family better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Sokhen's Group

texts.en:
Sokhen is 31 years old and married with four children. She is a citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. For the last 15 years, Sokhen has been growing corn and tobacco. She also works for others for a fee. With her current businesses, Sokhen can earn about 38,000 KHR per day and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs. She has been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle.

Sokhen is the leader of this group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to pay labor fees. Sokhen hopes to grow her crops fruitfully and sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living.
.

loans.use: to pay labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Chea is aged 44 years and widowed with nine children. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 44,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day. 

This is group loan for Chea’s group of two who are female, and she is the third cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chea is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong is 34 years old and married with two children. She is originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. For the last eight years, Kong has earned a living charging batteries in her village and she sometimes works for others for a fee. She also is a farmer. Kong is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 45,000 KHR each day for future needs. Kong is her third loan cycle with VisionFund and she completely repaid her prior two loans. She smartly used her loans to gradually improve her living.

Kong is the leader of a group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. In the future, she hopes to improve her income and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Den's Group

texts.en:
A 31-year-old mother of two children, Den resides in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea district, Cambodia. To support her family, she has been farming cassava and rice for 11 years. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day from this business and can save about 18,000 KHR each day for her future needs.  

This is the third loan for Den with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is now leading her group to seek a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Wildoro

texts.es:
Wildoro es un padre de familia dedicado, de 48 años con una maravillosa esposa con quien formó un hogar fortalecido con 2 hijos quienes ahora se han convertido en personas de bien, vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la Agricultura, el principal producto cultivado en sus terrenos son el cacao, cree que le va bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo, es responsable y gracias a ello puede sacar adelante a su familia.
Wildoro está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos así como comprar abono orgánico para tener una mejor cosecha, con esto sus ingresos mejorarán y más adelante podrá ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Wildoro, aged 48, is a devoted family man. He has a wonderful wife with whom he has made a home enriched with two children, who have grown up to be good people. He lives in San Martin with his family.

He has been making a living working in agriculture for several years.  He mainly grows cocoa beans in his fields. He believes that he is doing well because he always puts effort in everything he does, and he is a responsible person. And thanks to these qualities, he is able to get his family ahead.

Wildoro is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support, he will be able to do maintenance on his crops as well as buy organic fertilizer to have a better harvest. In this way, he will earn a better income, and, in the future, he will be able to see his children become great professionals.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Soeun's Group

texts.en:
Soeun, 51, is a villager in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children. She supports her living via tobacco growing, rice farming, and silk weaving. Beside these businesses, her husband has helped her to earn extra income via a fish-catching business. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. Now, she is a leader of a group consisting of two members. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy silk for weaving more valuable skirts for resale. She hopes to support her need on time with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy silk for weaving more valuable skirts for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Seab is aged 50 years and married. She has two children, with one in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and working as paid workers for 20 years. The current business earns them about 10,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 2,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

This is the third microloan for Seab with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past two loans, which have helped her make her living better. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a water pump to supply water for her farming business. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Set's Group

texts.en:
Seth is aged 28 years and married with two children who are too young for school. He is a rice farmer who has been in this business for five years to make a living. With the current business, he can earn about 23,000 KHR per day to meet his family’s needs and is able to save about 15,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Seth has been with VisionFund for two cycles and he is leading his group to seek a loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow his current business to earn a larger income and also hopes to extend his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 53 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for two years. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Pheap’s group consists of two members who are both female. She has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and completely paid back the loans which have helped her family with sufficient food and better support for the business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Les

texts.en:
Les is 44 years old and married with four children. He lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. Les and his wife earn a living as rice farmers. They have been farming for 11 years and their business earns them about 36,000 KHR per day. They manage to save about 26,000 KHR a day for their future needs. This is Les’s first loan cycle with VisionFund. 

Les is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice successfully and expand his current business to improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Kam Rieng district. Rice farming and cassava growing have been the main sources of her family’s income for about six years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 60,000 KHR.

This is the fifth loan for Vy with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek another loan. As the leader, Vy wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sreyda

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sreyda is a 28-year-old married mother of three children. One of the children is in school while the other two are too young for school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 11 years. Together, Sreyda and her husband can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet family’s needs and manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Sreyda just joined VisionFund for this cycle and now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She will also use a portion of the loan to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds and to pay for labor

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea, aged 26, lives in a rural village in the Phnom Proek district. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She and her husband are farmers. She has been in this business for four years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day.

This is the microloan for Kunthea’s group of two members, who are all female. They are in their first loan cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. Kunthea will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat is 57 years old and married with one kid. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. For the past ten years, Sat and her husband have earned a living raising ducks. 

Sat is the leader of a two-member group whose members are starting with VisionFund. She will use her portion of the group loan to buy ducks to raise. Sat hopes to fatten her ducks and sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy ducks to raise

loans.name: Olegario

texts.es:
Olegario es un padre ejemplar de 56 años, con una esposa que lo apoya de manera incondicional y y 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Hombre trabajador, desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, su principal producto cultivado es el cacao, él cree que le va bien porque tiene muchos conocimientos y experiencia sobre este cultivo y sobre todo porque es responsable y emprendedor.
Olegario está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar abono y cubrir los costos de mantenimiento de sus cultivos, de esta manera su producción mejorará. Su sueño es poder ampliar sus cultivos y tener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Olegario is a model father, 56 years old, with a wife who supports him without reserve and four children who are now adult.  As a hard-working man, he has earned a living in farming from his youth.  The main product he grows is cacao.  Olegario believes this work goes well for him because he has a lot  of knowledge and experience with growing this crop, and most of all, because he is responsible and enterprising.

Olegario is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have provided him he can buy fertilizer and cover the costs of maintaining his crops.  With this, his productivity will increase.  His dream is to be able to increase his crops and have a big harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his cacao crop

loans.name: Thien's Group

texts.en:
Thien, 42, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Bakan district. She is a married mother of two children. Her family’s income is from leased rice paddy. She has been in this business for 24 years to make a living. From her current business, she can earn about 37,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about 24,000 KHR per day for future needs.

Thien is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen, 44, lives with her husband and one son in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 26 years and her husband supplements the family’s income by working as a construction worker. The current business earns her about US$8 per day. 

Nen is on her first cycle with VisionFund. She is now asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy. She will also use a portion of it to pay labor fees.

With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak, 27, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She is married and has two children. For the last seven years, Sak has been farming rice, growing cassava and raising pigs. 

Sak has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Xoa is 53 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.
Xoa has a retail business selling construction supplies (iron, steel, cement, etc). She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Xoa is the group leader of the nhóm 05 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is Xoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction supplies (iron, steel, cement, etc) to resell.

The main hardship that Xoa faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Xoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (iron, steel, cement etc) to resell

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Ek Phnom province’s Battambang district, Vuth is aged 44 years and married with four children. For more than ten years, he and his wife have been growing cucumbers and cabbage. The current business earns him about 40,000KHR per day. 

Vuth has been a member of VisionFund for six cycles already and he wisely and successfully used the past loans to make his living condition better. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland. This loan will enable him to extend his farmland and increase his rice farming production. He will be able to grow more rice to improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: An old farmer who lives in Battambang province, Mon is 54 years old and a mother of eight children. She makes a living via rice farming and she also works as a paid worker to earn more income to support her family. She has been involved in the current business for ten years and it earns her about 31,100 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s parner) for ten cycles, and she has repaid her past loans completely. In this cycle, she is a leader of group of five members. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. She hopes this loan can help her make more income and make her family better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Thương is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

Thương has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Thương is the group leader of the nhóm 03 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. This is Thương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to make home products from wood to sell.

The main hardship that Thương faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to make wood furniture to sell.

loans.name: Saroun's Group

texts.en:
Aged 54 years, Saroun is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Bakan district of Pursat province. She is a mother of four children. She earns a living through farming rice, which she has been doing for 30 years. She earns about KHR23,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about KHR10,000 each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Saroun with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Saroun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production, to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
A 52 year-old man from Battambang province, Sorn is a father of five children. 

To overcome his family's financial burden, he has grown rice as his main source of income for 15 years. He also works as a paid worker to earn additional income. For Sorn, this is his second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has completely repaid his past loan.  He is the group leader of a group of two members,

He will spend this money to buy rice seed, fertilizer and plow the field to upgrade his farm. He hopes with this loan can provide for his family better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and plow the field to upgrade his farm.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn lives in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 47 years old and married with three children. 

To support her family, she has been selling grocery items while her husband works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 57,000 KHR per day to make a living. She can afford to save 15,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Sokhorn has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. Now she is leading her group of two female members to apply for a loan. Sokhorn will use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Eulalio De Jesus

texts.es: Eulalio de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como albañil en un cantón cercano al suyo, además su compañera de vida lo apoya prestando sus servicios domésticos. Eulalio no cuenta con uno de los servicios básicos en un hogar, como es la energía eléctrica por lo que desea instalarla lo antes posible pero no cuenta con  los recursos económicos necesarios es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: interruptores, caja termina, cables y alambre para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Eulalio, 22, lives in his own home with his life partner and their child of 2 years. He is a hardworking man who works as a mason in a canton near his. Additionally his life parter helps him, offering her domestic services. Eulalio doesn't have one of the basic services in a home: electric energy. Therefore, he wishes to install it as soon as possible but he doesn't have the necessary economic resources. It's because of this that he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: switches, a terminal box, cables and wire to install electricity in his home.

loans.use: to invest in: switches, a terminal box, cables and wire to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, a local farmer from Battambang province, is 48 years old and a mother of four children. She supports her living via rice cropping and food selling, which she has been involved in for a long time. For Tha, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely repaid her past loan. 

Now, she is a leader of a group consisting of two members. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She really hopes that this loan can make her family better off than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Nhat's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer residing in Battambang province, Nhat is 46 years old and a mother of four children. She covers the daily cost of living via rice cropping and she has a paid working job to earn extra income. 

This is her nine cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely repaid her past loan. Now, in a group of four, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide and pay for plowing fees for her farm. 

She hopes that she can make a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Santos Cecilia

texts.es: Santos de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer luchadora que todos los días  sale a ganarse el pan de cada día, apoyada en su pequeña venta de pescado, la cual realiza en los alrededores de su cantón de forma ambulante, además los fines de semana elabora tamales los cuales sale a vender en su cantón, y es gracias a estos esfuerzos que logra apoyar a su compañero de vida con los gastos económicos del hogar y apoyar a su hijo en los estudios. Santos habita en vivienda propia pero que como se observa en la fotografía está hecha de lámina por lo que ella desea comenzar a construir una de bloques de cemento, por lo que está solicitando a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y bloques de cemento para construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Santos, who is 47 years old, lives in her own home together with her life partner and her eight-year-old son.  She is a hardworking woman who goes out every day to earn her daily bread through her small fish selling business, which she carries out on foot in the areas surrounding her canton.  She also makes tamales on the weekends, which she goes out and sells in her canton, and it is thanks to these businesses that she is able to help her life partner with the household expenses and support her son's education.  Santos lives in her own home but, as you can see in the photo, is it made of sheet metal, which is why she wants to start to build a home of cement blocks.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, rebar, and cement blocks to build her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, rebar, and cement blocks to build her home.

loans.name: Buon's Group

texts.en: Buon, a local farmer from Pursat province, is 44 years old and a married mother of two children. Her one hectare of rice cropping is her main source of income and generates about 30,700 KHR per day. Buon, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before, formed a group of three to get a new loan. Buon, the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can make a good income to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Loeurb's Group

texts.en: Loeurb is 32 years old and married. She is a mother of two children; one is too young for schooling and one is in school. To overcome her family’s financial burden, she grows rice and catches fish for resale. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can triple her income so she can keep her kids in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and to buy insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Thavry

texts.en:
Thavry is 41-year-old mother of three children who lives in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district.  She grows rice in the local area and supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. She has been in the business for 5 years. 

This is the first loan for Thavry with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She requests a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en:
Lina is a young mother blessed with one young child, they live  in Battambang province. 

The main sources of her income are from growing soybeans and corn as well as working in construction.  She is the  leader of her 3-member group. It is the third loan for Lina and the first for her co-borrowers. 

Lina has successfully repaid her previously loan wisely and which she used to improve her living conditions. Lina will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed, insecticide, and  pay labor costs. She strongly believes that she can support her cash-crop on time.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, and  pay  labor costs.

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en: Aged 38 and a resident of Kampong Cham province, Bopha is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She deals with the daily cost of living via rice farming, whereas her husband works at construction sites to supplement the family’s income. This is the first loan for Bopha and her group consisting of three other borrowers. Bopha, the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat is 55-year-old  married woman from a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province,. She has four children, two of whom attend school. 

The primary source of her family’s income is from growing rice.  She also sells groceries to  support her family. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns $4 USD per day and manages to save about $3 USD each day after the expenses. 

Sat has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has successfully  repaid  the past loans. She requests a loan to pay for fertilizer and seeds for her farm. 

She hopes to improve her crop and increase her family’s income to provide a better standard of living  and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Esmeralda Isabel

texts.es: Esmeralda tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 5 años y 3 meses de edad. Esmeralda se dedica a la venta de tostadas, empanadas, y plátanos. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 6 años y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Esmeralda es una mujer visionaria quien siempre desea dar a su familia lo necesario. Con el apoyo que recibió en el pasado logró construir las paredes de su vivienda y en esta ocasión desea construir un corredor a la vivienda y poder así dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina, madera, clavos, hierro y para pagar la mano de obra necesaria  para la construcción.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 23 years old and lives in her own house with her two children, 5 years and 3 months old. Esmeralda works selling tostadas, empanadas and plantains. She has been selling as a street vendor for the past 6 years and this is how she achieves bringing the home the bread. Esmeralda is a visionary woman who always wishes to give her family what's necessary. With the support that she received in the past, she achieved construction the walls of her home.

On this occasion, she wishes to construct a hallway to the home and therefore be able to give her family better living conditions. With the amount applied for, she will buy laminate roofing, wood, nails, iron and will pay for the necessary labor for the construction.

loans.use: to buy: laminate roofing, wood, nails, iron and to pay for the necessary labor for the construction of the hallway of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for her son

loans.name: Maria Rosario Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es una señora de 57 años de edad que tiene 2 hijos, comenta que se dedica a la crianza de pollos  hace 5 años pero que a la crianza de otros animales  se dedica desde que era niña ya que su madre le enseño esta actividad, Beatriz vive con su esposo que trabaja al jornal  y con uno hijo que  se cayó de una motocicleta y desde ahí  no puede caminar,  Beatriz necesita el crédito para comprar pollos y lo que ella aspira es ampliar  su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos para de esta manera ayudarse con los gastos de la terapia de su hijo.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 57 year old woman who has 2 children. She says that she has been working raising chickens for the last 5 years, but she has been raising other animals since she was a girl - her mother taught her this activity. Beatriz lives with her husband who works as a day laborer and with a son who fell from a motorcycle and since then, he can't walk.

Beatriz needs the loan to buy chickens. She aspires to grow her business and improve her income to help herself, in this manner, with the therapy expenses for her son.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Chham's Group

texts.en: Chham, a resident from Battambang province, is 37 years old and a married father blessed with two little kids. He satisfies the needs of his household via rice cropping and a paid working job. This is the second microloan for Chham with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid his past loan wisely and it has given him a decent income to improve his livelihood. Now, he forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crop. He hopes that he can make more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crop.

loans.name: Mei's Group

texts.en: Mei is 35 years old and a mother of two children; one is too young for schooling and one is in school. To deal with the daily cost of living, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland and works for others for a fee. This business has generated her about 39,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Mei with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has given her a decent income. Now, she is the leader of a group of two. For Mei, her loan portion will be spent on purchasing fertilizer, and paying for plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman, 31, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Phnom Proek district of Pursat province, Cambodia. 

She has struggled to feed and care for her children by growing rice and selling groceries. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Saman recently joined  VisionFund and asks for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm.

loans.name: Zoila Maria

texts.es: Zoila tiene un negocio que es el de criar y comercializar  plantas, son ya 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, Zoila es casada y tiene 4 hijos mismos de los que 3 están estudiando,  el esposo de Zoila trabaja de chofer, el crédito lo necesita para comprar todo tipo de flores y  plantas frutales, ornamentales, medicinales y otras más, lo que Zoila aspira es mejorar su negocio, dar a conocer su producto que es de calidad y que le vengan clientes de otros  lugares, para de esta manera darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Zoila has a business growing and selling plants.  She has had this business for seven years now.  Zoila is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  Zoila's husband is a driver.  She needs this loan to buy all kinds of flowers and fruit plants, decorative plants, and medicinal plants, among others.  Zoila hopes to improve her business, to have her product, which is of good quality, become well known, and to attract customers from other areas so that she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy plants

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy, 32, is a farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has five children, two attend school and the others are not school-age.  

She earns about 45,000 KHR per day growing rice  to support her family. This is her fourth cycle  with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully  repaid her previous loans.

She is the leader of a 2-member group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that this loan can help her farm produce a  better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey, 45, is a farmer who lives in Battambang province. She is a mother of three children, one attends school. 

She grows rice and cassava as her main source of income and runs a grocery stall as the secondary source of income.  These businesses help her to secure the needs in her household,   

This is  her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of a 3-member group and will spend this money to buy rice seed and plow the field. 

She hopes that this loan will support the need of her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and plow the field.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en: A resident from Battambang province, Vorn is 30 years old and has one little kid. He tackles his family’s hardship via rice cropping and paid-working jobs. Nowadays, he can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. Vorn, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), formed a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy potash and insecticide for his crop. He highly believes that he can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy potash and insecticide for his crop.
